Massachusetts Soldiers and Sailors 

IN THE 

War of the Revolution. 



Note. — All names are given exactly as they appear on the original records. The order of 
arrangement of the facts of service in each individual record given is the same, as nearly as pos- 
sible, as the original entries, and is as follows : The name; the place of residence, if given ; the 
rank; the kind of document whereon the record appears; the enlistment and discharge, if 
given ; the time of service ; remarks. 

A discrepancy will sometimes be noted between the service given and the actual service as 
figured between the dates of enlistment and discharge. The difference is accounted for by the 
practice of including, with service performed, a time allowance for travel on the basis of one 
day for every 20 miles out or home. As the same name may appear under various forms, each 
carrying some portion of a record of service, it is necessary in order to obtain the complete 
record, as far as jireserved, of any given individual, to examine all the forms under which 
a name is stated to appear in the Record Index. 



Xea, . [This name appears under the form of Pec, Pee, Pie.] 

Peabadey, Francis. Matross, Capt. Amos Lincobi's (2d) co., [Lieut.] Col. Paul 
Revere's corps of artillery; service from Jan. 1, 1780, to May 8, 1780, 4 mos. 
8 days. Roll dated Boston. 

Peabeody, Seth, Sanford. Private, Capt. Morgan Lewis's Co., which marched 
April 21, 1775, in response to the alarm of April I'.l, 1775; service, 3 days. 

Peables, "William. Matross, Capt. John Wentworth's co. of matrosses, Col. 
Peter Noyes's regt. ; company mustered by Col. Noyes May 20, 1777, and sta- 
tioned at Fort Hancock, Cape Elizabeth. 

Peabodey, Andrew, Middleton. Private, Capt. Stephen Wilkens's co., Col. 
Wigglesworth's regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance, etc., from Albany 
home, sworn to Jan. 15, 1777; 220 miles travel allowed said Peabodey. 

Peabodey, "Famuel." Capt. Asa Prince's co., Col. Mansfield's regt. ; order for 
advance pay, signed by said Peabodey and others, dated Cambridge, June 8, 
1775 ; also, Capt. Prince's co., 19th regt. commanded by Col. Israel Hutchinson ; 
order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money ; memorandum on reverse 
of order states that money was paid to Capt. Prince Dec. 21, 1775. [See 
Samuel Peabody.] 

Peabodey, Jonathan. Matross, Capt. Amos Lincoln's (2d) co., [Lieut.] Col. Paul 
Revere's corps of artillery; service from Jan. 1, 1780, to May 8, 1780, 4 mos. 
8 days. Roll dated Boston. 

Peabodey, Samuel. Matross, Capt. Amos Lincoln's (Artillery) co. ; list of men 
entitled to small stores for 3 months, dated Castle Island, Sept. 17, 1779 ; also, 
Capt. Amos Lincoln's (2d) co., [Lieut.] Col. Paul Revere's corps of artillery; 
service from Jan. 1, 1780, to May 8, 1780, 4 mos. 8 days; roll dated Boston. 



2 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

Peabodey, Stephen, Middleton. Private, Capt. Jeremiah Putnam's co., Col. 
Nathan Tyler's regt. ; enlisted July 28, 1779; service to Dec. 1, 1779, 4 mos. 
3 days, at Rhode Island; also, same co. and regt.; pay roll for Dec, 1779, 
allowing 1 mo. 5 days service at Rhode Island, travel (106 miles) included. 

Peabody, . [This name also appears under the form of Peabadey, Peaheody, 

Peabodey, Peboddy, Pebodey, Pebody, Peedody, Peobody, Pheabody.J 

Peabody, Amasa. Private, Capt. John Robinson's co., Maj. Gage's regt. ; enlisted 
Oct. 4, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 6, 1777; service, 35 days; company marched to 
reinforce Northern army. 

Peabody, Amos. Capt. John Bodwell's co.. Col. Jacob Garrish's (Gerrish's) regt. 
of guards; service between April 2, 1778, and July 2, 1778, 2 mos. 29 days, at 
Cambridge ; also. Private, Capt. Benjamin Peabody's co.. Col. Wade's regt. ; 
entered service July 5, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 10, 1780 ; service, 3 mos. 18 days, 
including 12 days (240 miles) travel home ; regiment raised in Essex Co. to 
reinforce Continental Army for 3 months; also, receipt dated Middleton, 
April 16, 1781, for bounty paid said Peabody by Andrew Eliot, Chairman of a 
class of the town of Middleton, to serve in the Continental Army for the term 
of 3 years; also, Matross, Capt. Amos Lincoln's co. of matrosses; service 
from Nov. 1, 1782, to date of discharge, July 18, 1783, 8 mos. 18 days; roll 
dated Boston. 

Peabody, Andrew, Boxford (probably) . Private, Capt. Jacob Gould's co. of 
militia, Col. Samuel Johnson's regt., which marched on the alarm of April 
19, 1775; service, 3 days; reported returned homo. 

Peabody, Andrew, Boxford. Corporal, Capt. "William Pearley's co. of Minute- 
men, Col. James Frye's regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; 
service to April 25, 1775, 7 days ; reported enlisted Feb. 16, 1775 ; also, list of 
men returned as serving on picket guard under Maj. Baldwin, dated May 23, 
1775; reported detailed under Lieut. Jesse Hollister; also. Corporal, Capt. 
"William Perley's co., Col. James Frye's regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; 
enlisted April 26, 1775; service, 3 mos. 13 days; also, company return [jirob- 
ably Oct., 1775] ; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated 
Cambridge, Nov. 14, 1775. 

Peabody, Andrew, Boxford. Sergeant, Capt. Samuel Johnson's co.. Col. Tit- 
comb's regt. ; arrived at place of rendezvous April 27, 1777 ; discharged June 
27, 1777; service, 2 mos. 10 days, including travel (171 miles) to place of 
rendezvous and from place of discharge home ; company raised to serve for 
2 months from time of arrival at Providence, R. I. Roll dated Bristol. 

Peabody, Andrew, Middleton. Private, Capt. John Gay's co.. Col. Ebenezer 
Francis's regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance to camp and home, etc., 
sworn to in Suffolk Co., Nov. 29, 1776; said Peabody credited with allowance 
for 2 days (36 miles) travel ; company drafted from Roxbury, Dedham, Need- 
ham, Medfield, "Wrentham, "Walpole, Medway, Bellingham, Beverly, Dan- 
vers, Middleton, and Manchester.

(Artillery) regt. ; service from time of enlistment to Aug. 1, 1777, 38 days ; 
also, same co. and regt. ; list of men entitled to an additional bounty of £15, 
dated Boston, Jan. 12, 1778 ; also, same co. and regt. ; list of men who received 
bounty from April 30, 1777, to Dec. 30, 1777, 8 mos.

regt. of guards; engaged Dec. 23, 1777 ; service to April 3, 1778, 3 mos. 11 days, 
guarding Gen. Burgoyne's troops at "Winter Hill. Roll dated Bradford.

Peabody, Benjamin, Middleton. Sergeant, Capt. Asa Prince's co., which marched 
on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 2 days; also, Capt. Enoch Putnam's 
CO., Col. John Mansfield's regt. ; order for advance pay, signed by said Peabody 
and others, dated Cambridge, June 8, 1775 ; also, Sergeant, same co. and regt. ; 
muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; engaged May 9, 1775; service, 3 mos. ; also, 
Capt. Putnam's co., 19th regt. commanded by Col. Israel Hutchinson ; order 
for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Winter Hill, Oct. 27, 1775; 
also. Ensign, Capt. Benjamin Epes's co. ; list of officers of Col. Isaac Smith's 
regt. raised to serve vintil April 1 [year not givenj, as a temporary reinforce- 
ment to the army ; ordered in Coiincil March 13, 1776, that said officers be 
commissioned ; rei:)orted commissioned March 13, 1776 ; also. Captain, 5th co., 
8th Essex Co. regt. of Mass. militia; list of officers [year not given] ; also. 
Captain, Col. Jacob Gerrish's (1st) regt.; engaged Oct. 11, 1779; discharged 
Nov. 22, 1779; service, 1 mo. 22 days, near Claverack, including 11 days (220 
miles) travel home ; also, Captain, Col. Wade's regt. ; entered service June 19, 
1780; discharged Oct. 10, 1780; service, 4 mos. 4 days, including 12 days (240 
miles) travel home ; regiment raised in Essex Co. to reinforce Continental 
Army for 3 months ; also. Captain, Lieut. Col. Enoch Putnam's regt. ; engaged 
July 16, 1781 ; discharged Dec. 8, 1781 ; service, 5 mos. 5 days, including 12 
days (240 miles) travel home ; regiment raised in Essex and Plymouth counties 
to reinforce Continental Army for 3 montlis.

ley's CO. of Minute-men, Col. James Frye's regt., which marched on the alarm

officers of Col. Isaac Smith's regt. raised to serve until April 1 [year not 
given], as a temporary reinforcement to the army; ordered in Council March 
13, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported commissioned March 13, 
1776; also. Lieutenant, Capt. Richard Peabody's co.. Col. Edward Wiggles- 
worth's regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance from Ticonderoga in 1776 ; 
222 miles travel allowed said Peabody ; also, Lieutenant, Col. Brooks's regt. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Feb. 9, 1780; 
also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Daniel Lane's (8th) co.. Col. Ichabod Alden'sregt. ; 
return of field, staff, and commissioned officers [year not given] ; also, same 
regt. ; order for clothing, dated Cherry Valley, Dec. 13, 1778 ; also. Lieutenant, 
in a regiment formerly commanded by Col. Ichabod Alden ; return of field, 
staff, and commissioned officers, dated Boston, Jan. 5, 1779; also, return of 
field, staff, and commissioned officers in the 6th battalion formerly commanded 
by Col. Ichabod Alden who were in camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777, and 
who had not been absent subsequently except on furlough, etc., dated Cherry 
Valley, Feb. 24, 1779; also, Capt. Daniel Lane's (6th) co., 6th Mass. regt. 
formerly commanded by Col. Ichabod Alden ; muster roll for March and April, 
1779, dated Clierry Valley ; appointed Jan. 1, 1777 ; reported furloughed March 
24, 1779, by Gen. Clinton ; furlough to expire May 5, 1779; also, Lieutenant, 
Capt. Lane's (5th) co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks's (7th) regt. ; return of officers 
dated Sept. 9, 1780 ; reported resigned Feb. 9, 1780.

Peabody, Joseph, Boxford (also given Topsfield). Return made by a committee 
appointed to raise one-seventh part of the male inhabitants of the town of 
Boxford to serve in the Continental Army; engaged for town of Boxford; 
joined Capt. Job Whipple's co.. Col. Rufus Putnam's regt. ; term to expire 
Jan. 1, 1780; also, list of men raised to serve in the Continental Army from 
Col. Jonathan Cogswell's (3d) Essex Co. regt., as returned by Capt. Stephen 
Perkins and Capt. Nehemiah Herrick ; residence, Topsfield ; engaged for town 
of Topsfield; joined Capt. Haffield White's co.. Col. Rufus Putnam's regt.; 
term, 3 years ; also, Private, Capt. Job Whipple's co., Col. Rufus Putnam's 
4th (also given 5th) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
April 15, 1777, to April 14, 1780. 

Peabody, Joseph, Middleton. Private, Capt. Silas Adams's co.. Col. Titcomb's 
regt.; service, 2 mos., probably in May and June, 1777; 7 days (140 miles) 
travel allowed to and from place of rendezvous. Roll endorsed " for 2 Months 
service at R Island." 

Peabody, Joseph. Fifer, Capt. Nicholas Crosby's co.. Col. John Allan's regt.; 
enlisted Oct. 8, 1777 ; discharged Dec. 30, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 2 days, including 
10 days (200 miles) travel home ; regiment raised for defence of Machias ; also, 
Fifer, in an Artillery co. stationed at Machias for its defence ; entered service

Pearson, James, Jr., Wilmington. Private, Capt. Timothy Walker's co. of militia. 
Col. Green's re gt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 
4^ days; also, Capt. Ebenezer Bancroft's co., Col. Ebenezer Bridge's (27th) 
regt. ; receipt for advance pay, signed by said Pearson and others, dated Camp 
before Boston, July 24, 1775; also. Private, same co. and regt.; company 
return dated Sept. 25, 1775; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in 
money dated Nov. 4, 1775; also, list of persons who were hired to serve in

of Wilmington, and guaranteed $2 per month for each month's service in 
the Continental Army; a^.so, enlistment agreement dated May 13,1778, signed 
by said Pearson and others, engaging themselves to serve in the Continental 
Army to the credit of the town of Wilmington for the term of 9 months from 
the time of their arrival at Fishkill, the place of rendezvous, unless sooner 
discharged ; also, receipt given to Cadwallader Ford, Jr., dated Wilmington, 
June 1, 1778, signed by said Pearson, for £100 4s in part payment for engaging 
to serve for 9 months in the Continental Army to the credit of the town of 
Wilmington ; also, descriptive list of men raised from 3d Middlesex Co. regt. 
to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 9 months, agreeable to

Wilmington ; arrived at Fishkill July 27, 1778.

miners in Feb. and March, 1781.

days, defending frontiers of Lincoln Co. 

Pebody, Thomas. Private, Capt. Stephen Jenkins's co.. Col. Jacob Gerrish's 
regt.; entered service Oct. 14, 1779; discharged Nov. 22, 1779; service, 1 mo. 
20 days, at Claverack, including travel (240 miles) home; regiment detached 
from niilitia of Suffolk and Essex counties to reinforce army under Gen. Wash- 
ington ; also, Capt. Thomas Mighill's CO., Col. Nathaniel Wade's regt. ; en-

Ipswich ; regiment raised in Essex Co. to reinforce Continental Army for 
3 montlis.

order of Council of May 12, 1777.

that the service was rendered at Rhode Island.

78 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

Peirce, David, "Worcester. Private, Capt. Thomas Fish's co., Col. Nathan Tyler's

at Rhode Island ; roll sworn to at Newport ; also, same co. and regt. ; payroll

Peirce, David. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Benjamin Read's (4th) co., 2d Bristol Co.

1776, that said officers be commissioned ; rex)orted commissioned April 26,

Peirce, James, Amesbury (also given Wales, Lincoln Co.) . Private, Capt. James

to town of Amesbury; reported transferred to light infantry co. ; also, 
deposition dated March 13, 1820, signed by said Peirce, aged 59 years, a resi- 
dent of Wales, Lincoln Co., District of Maine, born in the Isles of Slioals, in 
which he deposes that he had enlisted into the Continental Army for during 
war in Capt. Smith's co., Col. Michael Jackson's regt., in Jan., 1777, and had 
served in said company and regiment as a Musician until June 13, 1783, when 
he had been honorably discharged at Newburgh ; a power of attorney to one 
Ebenezer Billings, of Boston, dated March 13, 1780, to collect all money that 
might be due said Peirce for and on account of his service in the Continental 
Army accompanies tlie deposition.

30, 1775 ; service, !)3 days ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; also, receipt for money in lieu 
of bounty coat dated Prospect Hill, Dec. 25, 1775. 

Peirce, John, Groton. Private, Capt. John Minot's co.. Col. Josiah Whitney's 
regt. ; arrived at destination May 10, 1777 ; discharged July it, 1777 ; service, 
2 mos. 9 days, at Rhode Island, including travel (8 days) to and from place 
of destination. Roll dated Warwick Neck. 

Peirce, John, Groton. Descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co. to rein- 
force the Continental Army for the term of 9 months from the time of their 
arrival at Fishkill, agreeable to resolve of April 20, 1778; 1st co.. Col. Reed's 
regt. ; age, 57 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; residence, Groton ; engaged for town 
of Groton ; arrived at Fishkill June 21, 1778.

Barber, Muster Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, Feb. 2, 1777; Capt. Asa 
Haynes'sco., Col. Edward Wigglesworth's regt.; also, Private, Major's co., 
Col. Calvin Smith's regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from 
Jan. 1, 1777, to July 1, 1770 ; reported deserted July 1, 1779 ; also, Capt. Aaron 
Haynes's co.. Col. Wigglesworth's regt. ; return [year not given] ; residence, 
Milton; engaged for town of Milton; mustered by Maj. Barber, at Boston; 
also, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for May, 1778, dated Valley Forge ; <(lso, 
same CO. and regt.; muster roll for June, 1778, dated Camp " Greeneage ; " 
also, same co. and regt. ; pay roll for Oct., 1778; also, Capt. John K. Smith's 
CO., (late) Col. Wigglesworth's regt. ; muster roll for March and April, 1770, 
dated Providence; enlisted Feb. 1, 1777; enlistment, during war; reported 
transferred to Major's co. ; also. Major's co., (late) Col. Wigglesworth's regt. 
commanded by Maj. John Porter; muster roll for March and April, 1779; en- 
listed Jan. 15, 1777; reported sick in hospital; also, descriptive list of desert-

"July 13th 1780;" Major's co. ; rank, Private ; age, 22 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 8 
in.; complexion, dark; hair, black; birthplace, Boston; residence, Boston; 
reported deserted July 12, 1779.

Partrick's co., Col. Alden's regt.; return dated Albany, Jan. 12, 1778; resi- 
dence, New Salem ; enlisted for town of New Salem ; mustered by Col. Wood- 
bridge, County Muster Master, and by a Continental Muster Master; also, 
(late) Capt. William Patrick's co., (late) Col. Ichabod Alden's (6th) regt.; 
return of men who were in camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777, and who had not 
been absent subsequently except on furlough, etc., certified at Cherry Valley, 
Feb. 24, 1779; also, Maj. Daniel Whiting's co., 6th Mass. regt. formerly com- 
manded by Col. Ichabod Alden ; muster roll for March and April, 1779, dated 
Cherry Valley; enlisted May 1, 1777; enlistment, 3 years; reported sick in 
general hospital at Albany.

Peirce, Jonathan. Private, Capt. Ebenezer Goodale's co., in a regiment com- 
manded by Lieut. Col. Samuel Williams; enlisted July 11, 1777; discharged 
Aug. 12, 1777 ; service, 1 mo. 9 days, including travel home ; company marched 
to join Northern army and was discharged 110 miles from home. 

Peirce, Jonathan. Corporal, Capt. Joseph Bellows's co. ; marched Aug. 22, 1777 ; 
travel out and home 180 miles ; service at 20 miles per day, 9 days, with 
Northern army; company marched from Lunenburg on an alarm at Benning- 
ton under command of Maj. Ebenezer Bridge, at request of Gen. Stark and 
Col. Warner, and was discharged by Gen. Lincoln after proceeding 90 miles. 

Peirce, Jonathan. Private, Capt. William Greenleaf's co., Col. Job Cushing's 
regt. ; enlisted Sept. 3, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 29, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 7 days, 
with Northern army, including travel (212 miles) home. Roll dated 
Lancaster.

and William Harbach, stating that they had engaged to serve in the Conti- 
nental Army for the term of 9 months from the time of their arrival at camp

Elliot's CO., Col. Holman's regt.; also, list of men raised in Worcester Co.

Peirce, Joshua, Leominster. Private, Capt. John Joslin's co. of Minute-men, 
Col. John Whetcomb's regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, 
to Cambridge ; service, 2 days ; reported enlisted into the army ; also, enlist- 
ment agreement dated April 26, 1775, signed by said Peirce and others, engag-

Peirce, Launcelot, Milton. Petition dated Milton, Oct. 8, 1777, signed by said 
Peirce, of Milton, stating that he had been drafted to serve in the army, agree- 
able to resolve of Aug. 8, 1777, but owing to his age, 54 years, and the poor 
condition of his health, as was duly certified, he was unable to perform mili- 
tary service and had provided an effective man, one William Stevens, to serve 
in his stead, and asking that said Stevens be accepted and that he, said Peirce, 
be relieved from the consequences of the draft ; ordered in Council Oct. 8, 1777, 
that William Stevens be accepted as a substitute for said Peirce. 

Peirce, Lemuel. Private ; pay roll of officers and men detached from Col. Gill's 
regt. for service under Capt. John Armstrong on a 40 days expedition to Rhode 
Island; service, 27 days; warrant allowed in Council Aug. -, 1782.

continue in service until regularly discharged and were therefore not made 
up on roll ; company marched July 27, 1777, by order of Gen. Worner (War- 
ner), to reinforce Northern army and was discharged Aug. 28, 1777.

Peirce, Timothy. Petition dated Boston, Nov. 24, 1778, signed by Leonard Jarvis, 
of Boston, asking that said Peirce be commissioned as commander of the ship 
" Maria ; " ordered in Council Nov. 24, 1778, that a commission be issued ; 
also, petition dated Boston, Dec. 26, 1781, signed by Jarvis & Russell, of 
Boston, asking that said Peirce be commissioned as commander of the ship 
"Caesar" (privateer) ; advised in Council Dec. 26, 1781, that a commission 
be issued and that the naval officer of the port of Boston be directed to clear 
said vessel for Hispaniola with a cargo of pickled fish which was unfit for 
home consumption.

16, 1781 ; term, 3 years ; also, list of men mustered in Middlesex Co. ; mustered 
March 30, 1781. 

Pelham, Thomas, Gloucester. Private, Capt. Samuel Page's co., Col. Benjamin 
Tupper's regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 18, 1777, 
to Dec. 31, 1779; residence, Gloucester; credited to town of Gloucester; also, 
Capt. Page's co.. Col. Ebenezer Francis's regt. ; subsistence allowed from 
date of enlistment, Jan. 18, 1777, to time of arrival at Bennington; credited 
with 67 days allowance ; the Captain and 1st Lieutenant to march April 1, 
1777, the rest to march March 12, 1777; also, Maj. William Lithgow's co., 
Col. Benjamin Tupper's regt. ; muster roll for March, 1779, dated West Point ;

accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Jan. 10, 1780; reported discharged 
Jan. 10, 1780. 

Pelham, Thomas. Private, Capt. John Lane's co.. Col. Foster's regt. ; entered 
service Jan. 10, 1776 ; service to Feb. 15, 1776, 1 mo. 5 days ; company stationed 
at Cape Ann for defence of seacoast ; also, Capt. Daniel Giddings's co., Col. 
Joseph Foster's regt. ; entered service Feb. 15, 1776 ; discharged Oct. 20, 1776 ; 
service, 8 mos. 4 days; company stationed at Gloucester for defence of 
seacoast. 

Pelham, Thomas. Statement dated Boston, Sept. 22, 1777, signed by said Pelham 
and others belonging to Col. Crafts's regt., declaring their refusal to leave 
Boston, unless their bounty or wages, or both, were made equivalent to those 
allowed the soldiers of the Continental train of artillery; also, petition 
addressed to Col. Thomas Crafts, dated Camp at Boston, Sept. 25, 1777, signed 
by said Pelham and others, requesting that the objectionable part of their 
former petition, which was considered mutinous, be stricken out, and asking 
that the sergeants of the regiment confined on account of the petition be 
released; also. Drummer, Capt. Turner Phillips's (8th) co.. Col. Thomas 
Crafts's (Artillery) regt. ; engaged May 8, 1777 ; service to Aug. 1, 1777, 84 
days ; also, same co. and regt. ; return of men entitled to an additional bounty 
of £15, as returned by Col. T. Crafts, dated Boston, Jan. 12, 1778; also, same 
CO. and regt. ; list of men who received bounty from April 30, 1777, to Dec. 
30, 1777, 8 mos. 

Pell, Edward. Foreman, Director John Torrey's co. of bakers; service from 
Oct. 1, 1778, to Dec. 31, 1778, 3 mos. Roll certified at Boston.

returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Maj. Peter Harwood, 
of 6th Mass. regt., at Springfield, July 2, 1780; age, 18 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 3

miles) included.

discharged ; also, pay roll for same service certified at Sheffield.

Perkins, Benjamin, Falmouth. Receipt dated Concord, June 5, 1778, for bounty

20, 1778; age, 27 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 10 in. ; residence, Falmouth ; engaged for 
town of Concord; also, letter from John Buttrick, one of the committee of 
the town of Concord, and others, to Maj. Gen. Heath, at Boston, dated Con- 
cord, June 13, 1778, stating that said Perkins had engaged to serve for the 
town of Concord but had lost his sight by reason of a cold and was therefore 
rendered unable to serve, and requesting authorization to require him to fur- 
nish a suitable man to serve in his stead.

Perkins, John. Petition signed by David Parkins and others, for and in behalf 
of said John Perkins and others belonging to Capt. John Black's co.. Col. 
Jonathan Brewer's regt., asking allowances for lost guns, bounty coats, 
etc. ; certificate dated Hutchinson, April 22, 1776, signed by Capt. Black, cer- 
tifies that said Perkins was wounded and taken prisoner at the battle of 
Bunker Hill June 17, 1775, that he had received letters from him while in 
jail at Boston, and that said Perkins had never received bounty coat asked 
for; certificate signed by the Selectmen of Hutchinson, certifies that David 
Parkins was father of said John Perkins; also, order on the Committee of 
Clothing, payable to Jolin Mason, dated Watertown, Oct. 19, 1776, signed by 
said Perkins, for money due in lieu of a bounty coat; also, certificate dated 
Hutchinson, Oct. 18, 1776, signed by the Selectmen, certifying that said Per- 
kins was a soldier in Capt. John Black's co.. Col. Jonathan Brewer's regt., 
in the " last years Campaign " and had not received a bounty coat or value 
thereof; certificate endorsed " p'd Oct. 25th 1776."

Perkins, Thomas. Descriptive return made by Edward Procter, Colonel of Boston

charged, and who had received bounty and mileage due them of said Col. 
Procter; Capt. Kneeland's co. ; age, 46 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, 
brown ; also, descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army 
for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as re- 
ceived of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Spring- 
field, July 16, 1780; age, 55 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 6 in.; complexion, light; 
engaged .for town of Boston ; marched to camp July 16, 1780, under command 
of Lieut. Zebulon King; reported rejected by Gen. Glover, being 55 years 
old, laboring under many bodily infirmities, and having been discharged from 
the British service some years before ; also. Council order dated July 26, 1780, 
directing Col. Edward Proctor, of the Boston regt., to detach from said regi- 
ment two able-bodied men to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 6 
months in the room of said Perkins and Adam Rupp who had been sent for- 
ward as recruits but who were rejected by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Spring- 
field ; said Perkins reported as 60 years of age, very lame in his hip, and unfit 
for service.

days, including 5 days (100 miles) travel home.

178 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

Pebmenter, Ezra. Letter from Samuel Dow to James Perkins, dated Boston, 
Jan. 15, 1786, in behalf of himself, said Permenter, and others, stating that 
they had been employed as blacksmiths in the Quarter Master's department 
at Boston from early in 1776 to Jan. 1, 1778, when owing to depreciation of 
money their wages were insufficient, whereupon they applied to Col. Chase, 
Deputy Quarter Master General, for £9 specie per month, or its equivalent, as 
wages, but as they failed to receive any increased allowance, they aj)plied to 
Gen. Heath, who promised to write to Gen. Pickering and secure the advance 
requested; they remained continuously in service until Sept., 1780, their pay 
remaining unchanged until March 1, 1780, when they were allowed £9 per 
month in specie notes; the claim for the extra allowance asked for was 
apparently not granted, as the foregoing letter was read in Continental Con- 
gress and returned to said Dow without action, and two endorsements bearing 
dates Boston, Oct. 15, 1788, and Sept. 27, 1790, show that the grievance of the 
claimants was not redressed at the respective dates. 

Permenter, Jacob, Oakliam. List of men raised to serve in the Continental 
Army, as returned by Capt. Elisha Hunt, sworn to in Hampshire Co., April 
14,1779; residence, Oakham; engaged for town of Northfield ; term, 3 years 
or during war. 

Permenter, Jacob, "Weston. Private, Capt. Samuel Lamson's co. of militia, 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 3 days.

from place of discharge home.

Perrey, Israel, Hanover. 1st Lieutenant; communication addressed to the 
Council, signed by Joseph Cushing, Brigadier for Plymouth Co., stating that 
said Perrey and others had been chosen officers of a Matross company raised 
by enlistment in the town of Hanover to be commanded by Prince Stetson as 
Captain, and requesting that they be commissioned ; ordered in Council June 
27, 1777, that commissions be delivered said officers; reported commissioned 
June 27, 1777; company stationed at Hanover.

town, Dec. 23, 1775; also, list of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster 
Master for Suffolk Co., dated Boston, May 25, 1777; Capt. Watson's co.. Col. 
Greaton's regt. ; also. Private, Capt. Abraham Watson's co., Col. John 
Greaton's (2d) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 

1777, to Feb. 3, 1780 ; credited to town of Holden ; reported killed Feb. 3, 1780 ; 
also, same co. and regt.; return [year not given]; residence, Stockbridge; 
enlisted for town of Stockbridge ; mustered by County Muster Master Barber ; 
term, during war.

burne, March 25, 1776 ; ordered in Council March 28, 1776, that said officers

missioned March 27, 1776.

Perry, John. Petition signed by said Perry and Thomas Thompson, in behalf of 
the inhabitants of St. Georges, asking that a guard be stationed near " Bagi- 
duce " and that said Perry be commissioned as commander of the boat " Fly," 
designed to check the trade carried on between the enemy and the inhabitants 
near Penobscot; advised in Council Aug. 21, 1781, that a commission be 
issued; also, petition dated Boston, June 26, 1782, signed by Israel Mead, in 
behalf of himself and others, of Boston, asking that said Perry be commis- 
sioned as commander of the boat " Fly " (privateer) ; advised in Council June 
28, 1782, that a commission be issued.

Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned

and regt.; pay rolls for June-Sept., 1778, dated Fort Clinton; also, same co. 
and regt. ; pay rolls for Nov. and Dec, 1778, dated King's Ferry.

8, 1776. Roll dated Northbridge.

East Greenwich, Sept. 17, Sept. 24, Oct. 14, and Nov. 13, 1778; enlistment to 
expire Jan. 1, 1779.

Major, Col. Jaiues Wesson'.s (Oth) regt. ; Continental Army i>ay accounts for 
service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779 ; reported as serving 30 iiios. 26 days 
as Captain, 5 mos. 4 days as Major ; also, certiticate dated Boston, signed by said 
Pettengill, stating that he was a Captain in one of the fifteen battalions of 
Massachusetts, was in camp on or before Aug. 15, 1777, and had not been absent 
subsequently except on furlough ; aim, Major ; list of officers in the Continental 
Army ; commissioned Nov. 25, 1777 ; also, return of officers for clothing, dated 
Boston, Oct. 19, 1778; also. Major; list of settlements of rank of Continental 
officers, dated West Point, made by a Board held for the i^urpose and confirmed 
by Congress Sept. 6, 1779 ; commissioned July 26, 177!) ; also. Major, Col. Wes- 
son's regt. ; return of officers, dated West Point, Sept. 12, 1779 ; also, same 
regt. ; return of officers for clothing, dated Boston, Sept. 25, 1779; also, memo- 
rial dated Boston, Sept. 12, 1781, signed by said Pettengill, Major, 1st Mass. 
regt., stating that in consequence of his having been appointed to the com- 
mand of the rendezvous at Boston, it became his duty to acquaint the General 
Court with the deficiencies in the several counties within his district of the 
Commonwealth's quota of recruits directed to be raised for the purpose of 
filling up the regiments of the Continental Line, and also calling attention to 
the prevalence of desertion, in order that the General Court might take 
measures in the matter; also. Major, Col. Joseph Vose's (1st) regt.; return 
of effectives, dated West Point, Aug. 2, 1782 ; reported on command at Boston 
by leave of Gen. Lincoln ; also, return of effectives, dated Quarters, Jan. 17, 
1783; reported on furlough in Massachusetts by leave of Gen. Washington 
from Jan. 2, 1783.

returned as received of Jonathan Warner, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. J. 
Glover, at Fort Arnold, July 8, 1778.

roy's CO., Col. Chapen's regt. ; residence, Northampton ; arrived at Fishkill 
June 16, 1778.

in Northern department, including travel (120 miles) home; also. Lieuten- 
ant, 3d CO., Col. Elisha Porter's (4th Hampshire Co.) regt. ; list of officers in 
said regiment certified by Brig. Gen. T. Danielson April 18, 1780, as having 
been previoiisly certified to the Council by Col. Porter for resignations on the 
ground that such a course would be for the good of the service, and suggesting 
that action be taken in the matter; ordered in Council April 18, 1780, that the 
resignations of said officers be accepted. 

Phelps, Aaron, Rutland. Private, Capt. Thomas Eustis's (Rutland) co. of Min-

Phelps, John. Receipt dated June 17, 1777, signed by Ensign Sturgin Sloan, for 
money paid him by Capt. "William Douglas for procuring said Phelps and 
Samuel Willard to serve in the Continental Army to the credit of the town of 
Hancock.

Aug. 2, 1780; discharged Aug. 7, 1780; service, 6 days; company marched to 
Rhode Island on an alarm.

22, 1775, making disposition of the forces aboixt Boston and dividing the army 
into 3 grand divisions to consist of 2 brigades each ; said Phiney's regt. assigned 
to a brigade to be commanded by Brig. Gen. Heath, which, with another 
brigade and a reserve corps, were to be commanded by Maj. Gen. Putnam.

Phinny, Edmund. Regimental return with accompanying petition addressed to 
the Council, dated Oct. 4, 1775, signed by said Phinny, Colonel, stating that 
he had commanded a regiment in the army at Cambridge during " the present 
Campaign " but had never been commissioned, and asking that he, with the 
officers in his regiment, be recommended to Gen. Washington for commis- 
sions ; ordered in Council Oct. 6, 1775, that said officers be recommended for 
commissions in the Continental Army.

lency John Hancock to serve on a 40 days expedition.

Salem, May 15, 1776, signed by said Pickering, Colonel, and Joseph Sprague, 
of officers chosen by the several companies of militia in Salem and returned 
to be commissioned; said officers accepting the appointments, however, only 
upon the condition that the General Court would compel a more equal dis- 
tribution as to the persons required to undergo military training and to be 
subject to service calls, and also in order th.it the existing companies might 
be kept fully trained and equipped ; ordered in Council June 6, 1776, that said 
officers be commissioned; also, return made to Maj. Gen. James Warren, of 
officers of said Pickering's regiment raised by Brig. Michael Farley from his

Camp West Point ; reported on command at West Point from Aug. 1,1782; 
also, Lieutenant and Paymaster, same regt. ; returns of effectives, dated Camp 
Philadelphia, July 11, and July 18, 1783; reported on command at West 
Point; Gi^.s'o, Lieutenant ; returns of effectives between July 25, 1783, and Aug. 
22, 1783, dated Camp Philadelphia ; reported on command at West Point.

Pierce, William, Milton. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Ebenezer Tucker's (Milton) co. 
of militia, which marched in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 
7 days, before completion of standing army.

PiERCET, Thomas, Georgetown (also given Bradford). Private, Capt. William 
Hudson Ballard's co.. Col. Brooks's regt.; Continental Army pay accounts 
for service from April 1, 1777, to Dec. 20, 1777 ; residence, Bradford ; reijorted 
deserted; also, Capt. Ballard's co., 6th Mass. regt. formerly commanded by 
Col. Ichabod Alden ; return of men who were in camp on or before Aug. 15, 
1777 ; reported furloughed Oct. 20, 1777, and not returned ; also, same co. and

town of Bradford; mustered by Maj. Ilsley, Muster Master for Cumberland 
Co., and by a Continental Muster Master; reported on furlough ; also, 1st co., 
Col. Brooks's (7th) regt. ; return made up to Dec. 31, 1779; enlisted March 31, 
1777; enlistment, 3 years; reported deserted Dec. 21, 1777. 

PiERCY, David, Westfield. Private, in a Westfield co. of Minute-men commanded 
by Lieut. John Shephard, which marched April 20, 1775, in response to the 
alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 1 week 1 day; reported enlisted into the army 
April 28, 1775; also, Private, Maj. Ifebbeus Ball's co.. Col. William Shep- 
pard's 4th (also given 3d) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service 
from Feb. 7, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; reported as serving 9 mos. 24 days as Pri- 
vate, 17 mos. as Corporal, 8 mos. as Sergeant ; also, Capt. Lebbeus Ball's co., 
Col. William Shepard's regt. ; return dated Feb. 3, 1778 ; residence, Westfield ; 
enlisted for town of Westfield ; mustered by County and Continental Muster 
Masters ; also. Corporal, same co. and regt. ; muster roll for July and Aug., 
1778, dated Providence; also, Maj. Ball's co.. Col. Shepard's regt.; muster 
rolls for Nov., 1778, March, and April, 1779, dated Camp at Providence; 
enlisted March 25, 1777 (also given Feb. 4, 1777) ; enlistment, during war; 
reported appointed Corporal Dec. 10, 1777, appointed Sergeant April 1, 1779; 
also, Sergeant, Major's co.. Col. Shepard's regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780 ; also, same co. and 
regt. ; return for gratuities, dated Higlilands, Feb. 24, 1780; gratuity paid said 
Piercy Jan. 29, 1780; also, same co. and regt. ; return for the year 1780, dated 
West Point and endorsed " Capt. Fullers Comp'y."

Suffolk Co. to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months.

PiERPONT, Joseph. Quarter Master, Col. Thayer's (Suffolk Co.) regt. ; list of offi- 
cers to command men detached from militia to reinforce the Continental Army

for 3 mos. service as a reinforcement to the Continental Army during 1780.

newly appointed Commissary, the charge and custody of the prison-ship " Ris- 
ing Empire," and a list of the names and ranks of prisoners confined on board 
said vessel.

Mr. Emery, Paymaster, (late) 6th Mass. regt., payable to Benjamin Heywood, 
dated Worcester, June 10, 1784, signed by said Pike, for wages for Feb. -April, 
1783.

artificers; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Dec. 1 to Dec. 31, 
1779; also, Capt. Faxon's co.. Col. Flower's regt.; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; residence, Boston; 
company stationed at Springfield.'

others, engaging themselves to serve for the Province for the term of 1 year, 
unless sooner discharged. 

Pike, James. Corporal, Capt. Reuben Butterfield's co. ; engaged Dec. 16, 1776;

also allowed.

for the term of 5 weeks.

Boston.

Pike, James. Sergeant, Capt. Thomas Whipple's co. of guards ; entered service 
April 20, 1780; discharged Dec. 20, 1780; service, 8 mos. 1 day; company 
raised for 8 months and stationed at Rutland.

due said Pike for service to Dec. 14, 1783, on board the frigate " Hague," 
commanded by Capt. John Manley. 

Pike, Jeremiah. Private, Capt. Eli Parker's co.. Col. Leonard's regt.; enlisted

days; company marched from Hampshire Co. May 8, 1777, to reinforce Conti- 
nental Army at Ticonderoga for 2 months. 

Pike, Jeremiah. Private, Capt. Abner Pomeroy's co.. Col. Ezra Wood's regt. ;

April 20, 1778, and marched to the state of New York ; also, Corporal, same

Pike credited with 17 days service, being 6 days in camp, 3 days preceding

Aug., 1778; said Pike credited with 19 days service.

in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched July 10, 1780 ; discharged Dec. 
5, 1780; service, 5 mos. 5 days, including travel (180 miles) home.

service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster in a 
return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; aho, payroll for 6 months men 
raised by the town of Sterling for service in the Continental Army during 
1780; marched July 10, 1780; discharged Dec. 22, 1780; service, 5 mos. 22 
days, including travel (100 miles) home. 

Pike, William, Roxbury (also given Natick). Corporal, Capt. Joseph Morse's 
CO., Col. John Patterson's regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted July 
12, 1775; service, 19 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775]; also,

March 1, 1777 ; term, during war ; also, same regt. ; return dated Jan. 28, 1781,

Capt. Crafts.

1777, signed by said Pilsberry and others belonging to Col. Crafts's regt., de- 
claring their refusal to leave Boston, unless their bounty or wages, or both, 
were made equivalent to those allowed the soldiers of the Continental train 
of artillery; also, petition addressed to Col. Thomas Crafts, dated- Camp at 
Boston, Sept. 25, 1777, signed by said Pilsberry and others, requesting that the 
objectionable part of their former petition, which was considered mutinous, 
be stricken out, and asking that the sergeants of the regiment confined on 
account of the petition be released; also, Capt. Gray's (3d) co.. Col. Crafts's 
regt. ; return of men who marched on a secret expedition to Rhode Island and 
were entitled to bounty, dated Boston, Jan. 8, 1778.

Hull from July 26, 1777, to Sept. 11, 1777 ; roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. and 
endorsed " Men drafted from Boston Reg't."

service, 6 days.

Col. Samuel Bullard's regt.; enlisted Aug. 29, 1777; discharged Nov. 29,

Col. Lee's, Col. Henley's, and Col. Jackson's regts., and men belonging to

a regiment under the command of Col. Henry Jackson, agreeable to the 
arrangement of April 9, 1779; rank. Private ; Capt. Hastings's co. ; residence, 
Scarborough; engaged for town of Salem; engaged Nov. 22, 1777; term, 

3 years; also, Capt. John Hastings's (2d) co., Col. Henry Jackson's (16th) 
regt. ; pay rolls for April-July, 1780.

Pollard, Solomon, Billerica. Captain of a company of militia. Col. Green's 
regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 16 days; also, 
list of men belonging to said Pollard's (Billerica) co. in camp at Cambridge, 
dated May 1, 1775; also, report signed by said Pollard, Clerk, of a meeting 
held at Chelmsford Jan. 29, 1776, by a company of the temporary reinforce- 
ment composed of men from Billerica, Chelmsford, Dracut, Dunstable, 
Tewksbury, and Bedford, to elect officers; ordered in Council Feb. 7, 1776, 
that commissions be issued to officers chosen; also, Captain, 3d co.. Col. 
Simeon Spaulding's (7th Middlesex Co.) regt. of Mass. militia ; list of officers ; 
commissioned April 2, 1778; also. Captain, Col. Samuel Denny's regt.; 
engaged Oct. 23, 1779; discharged Dec. 4, 1779; service, 1 mo. 12 days, includ- 
ing travel (200 miles) home ; regiment detached to march to Claverack and 
join Continental Army for 3 months ; also, resignation addressed to the Coun- 
cil, dated Billerica, May 9, 1780, signed by said Pollard, stating that he had 
been chosen Captain of 3d co., 7th Middlesex Co. regt., in 1774, and had later 
been commissioned, that he had subsequently served to the best of his ability, 
having "lately" served on a short campaign, and resigning his commission 
on account of his age and the condition of his health ; resignation accepted in 
Council May 10, 1780.

service Sept. 20, 1777 ; discharged Oct. 14, 1777 ; .service, 30 days, under Col. 
Ezra May on expedition to Saratoga, including travel (112 miles) home.

Pomeroy, Pliny, Northampton. Private, Capt. Jonathan Allen's co. of Minute- 
men, Gen. Pomeroy's regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in response to the

April 27, 1775; also, Capt. Jonathan Allen's (3d) co.. Col. John Fellows's 
(8th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 27, 1775; service, 
3 mos., 1 week, 4 days; also, company return dated Dorchester, Oct. 7, 1775; 
also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Dorchester Camp, 
Nov. 7, 1775; also. Private, Capt. Jonathan Wales's co., in a regiment com- 
manded by Lieiit. Col. S. Williams; engaged Dec. 20, 1776; discharged 
March 20, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 10 days, including 10 days (200 miles) travel 
home ; roll dated Morristown ; also, list of men raised to serve in the Conti- 
nental Army, as returned by Capt. Oliver Lyman and Capt. Joseph Cooke, 
sworn to in Hampshire Co., April 8, 1779; residence, Northampton ; engaged 
for town of Northampton ; joined Capt. Jonathan Allen's co.. Col. Putnam's 
regt. ; term, 3 years; also. Private, Capt. Whipple's co.. Col. Rufus Putnam's 
regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from July 17, 1780, to Oct. 17, 
1780; reported deserted Oct. 17, 1780 [said Pomeroy and others, of Northamp- 
ton, left camp Jan. 1, 1780, under the misapprehension that their terms of 
service had expired, when in reality they were held liable to serve a full three 
years term from the dates of their enlistments, and were accordingly returned 
as deserters; they later returned to the army, a resolve having been passed 
June 15, 1780, remitting the penalties for unintentional desertion where 
soldiers returned to duty and filled out the full three years term ; they again 
left the service without permission, but the second charge of desertion was 
an unjust one and arose from a misconstruction on the part of their officers as 
to the additional time they were required to serve ; their wages were allowed 



m THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 517

and made up for the full three years service by authority of resolve of April 
20, 1781] ; also, Private, Capt. Ebenezer Strong's co. of volunteers, 2d Hamp-

ley June 13, and at Northampton May 6, June 15, 16, and 17, 1782, (5 days, by

ment.

Pond, Elihu (also given Elisha) , continued. 

field, Sept. 20, 1779; also, Private, Capt. John Holclen's co., Col. Thomas 
Nixon's regt. ; pay rolls for Aug. -Dec., 1779; enlisted July 26, 1779; also, 
(late) Capt. John Holden's co., Col. Thomas Nixon's (6th) regt. ; pay roll for 
Jan. -June, 1780; reported taken prisoner Feb. 3, 1780; also, Capt. Peter 
Clayes's co. ; pay abstract of officers and men who had been omitted in 
abstracts made up previous to Aug. 1, 1780; service, 5 mos. 27 days; reported 
joined from captivity and account made up from Feb. 3, 1780; also, Capt. 
Peter Clayes's co., 6th Ma.ss. regt. ; pay roll for Nov. and Dec, 1780; service, 
4 mos. 23 days ; account of said Pond reported as made up from Feb. 3, 1780, 
to date of his discharge, Dec. 23, 1780; also, petition dated Franklin, Feb. 
5, 1781, signed by said Pond, stating that he had enlisted into the Conti- 
nental Army for the term of 9 months to the credit of the town of Franklin 
and that he had passed muster at Springfield, July 26, 1779, and thereafter 
served as Private in Col. Thomas Nixon's (6th) regt. ; that while serving in 
a detachment under Lieut. Col. Thompson near White Plains he had been 
captured Feb. 3, 1780, and taken to the city of New York, where he had 
remained until Dec. 12, 1780, when he was exchanged at Elizabeth Town 
Point ; that he had been detained 7 mos. 23 days beyond the term of his enlist- 
ment and had lost his gun, which was his personal property ; and asking that 
in addition to the bounty granted for the 9 months service he might be 
allowed compensation for the loss of his gun and for the time spent in cap- 
tivity ; March 13, 1781, £39, new emission, allowed the petitioner, but his per- 
sonal receipt is in acceptance of £30.

Pond, Peter, Dartmouth. List of men raised for the 6 months service and returned

mouth for service in the Continental Army during 1780 ; marched June 4, 
1780; discharged Dec. 16, 1780; service, 6 mos. 22 days, travel (220 miles) 
included ; also, descriptive list of men raised to serve in the Continental 
Army, agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 1780, returned as received by John Burt, 
at Taunton, July 6, 1781, to be conducted to Springfield and delivered to Col. 
Shepard, but reported as having been delivered to Maj. Pettingall at Boston ; 
age, 16 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. li in.; complexion, black; occupation, laborer; 
engaged for town of Dartmouth ; engaged June 30, 1781 ; term, 3 years.

for the term of 9 months from the time of their arrival at Fishkill, agreeable 
to resolve of April 20, 1778, dated Taunton, May 19, 1778; Capt. Ephraim 
Hathaway's co.. Col. Edward Pope's (2d Bristol Co.) regt. ; age, 16 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 5 in.; complexion, dark; hair, brown; eyes, gray; residence,

hair, brown ; eyes, blue ; engaged for town of Dighton ; reported delivered to 
Lieut. J. Grace. 

Pool, Francis (also given Francis, Jr.), Cape Ann. Corporal, Capt. John Row's 
CO., Col. Ebenezer Bridge's (27th) regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; en- 
listed April 29, 1775; service, 20 days; reported killed June 17, 1775; also, 
order on Henry Gardner, Treasurer, payable to Samuel Whittemore, dated 
Gloucester, Nov. 15, 1776, signed by Francis Pool, for the allowance made his 
son, said Francis Pool, Jr., for losses sustained at the battle of Bunker Hill, 
June 17, 1775 ; certificate on reverse of order, dated Gloucester, Nov. 15, 1776, 
signed by the Selectmen, certifies that Capt. Francis Pool was the proper per- 
son to receive the wages, etc., due his son, a soldier in Capt. John Row's co., 
who was killed at Bunker Hill.

Pool, Samuel, Falmouth. Capt. Samuel Noyes's co.. Col. Edmund Phinnie's 
(31st) regt. ; billeting allowed from date of enlistment, July 11, 1775, to date 
of marching from Falmouth, July 13, 1775 ; credited with 2 days allowance ; 
also, Drummer, same co. and regt. ; company return dated Fort No. 2, Cam- 
bridge [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in 
money dated Fort No. 2, Cambridge, Oct. 27, 1775. 

Pool, Samuel, Littleton. Descriptive list of men raised to reinforce the Conti- 
nental Army for the term of 6 months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, 
returned as received of Justin Ely, Commissioner, by Col. Timothy Bigelow, 
at Springfield, Sept. 7, 1780; age, 30 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in.; complexion, 
ruddy; engaged for town of Littleton; arrived at Springfield Aug. 29, 1780; 
marched to camp Sept. 7, 1780, under command of Ensign Simonds; also, list 
of men raised for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as 
having passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also. 
Private, Capt. Job Sumner's co.. Col. John Greaton's (3d) regt. ; muster roll 
for Oct., 1780; enlisted Aug. 29, 1780; enlistment, 6 months; also, pay roll for 
6 months men raised by the town of Littleton for service in the Continental 
Army during 1780; marched July 15, 1780; discharged Dec. 6, 1780; service, 
5 mos. 2 days, travel (220 miles) included ; also, receipt dated Littleton, April 
24, 1781, for bounty paid said Pool by Class No. 8 of the town of Littleton to 
serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years; also, list of men 
returned as having been mustered in Middlesex Co. since last previous return ; 
engaged for town of Littleton ; reported mustered March 30, 1781 ; also, 
descriptive list of men raised in Middlesex Co., agreeable to resolve of Dec. 2, 
1780, as returned by Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for said county; age, 
31 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 8 in. ; comjilexion, light; hair, light; eyes, light; occu- 
pation, farmer; engaged for town of Littleton; engaged May 1, 1781; term, 

3 years ; reported deserted. 

Pool, Samuel, Reading. List of 6 months men raised agreeable to resolve of June 
5, 1780, returned as received of Maj. Joseph Hosmer, Superintendent for Mid- 
dlesex Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, dated Springfield; also, descrip- 
tive list of men raised to reinforce the Continental Army for the term of 6 
months, agreeable to resolve of June 5, 1780, returned as received of Justin 
Ely, Commissioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Springfield, July 11, 1780; 
age, 18 yrs.; stature, 5 ft. 5 in.; complexion, ruddy; engaged for town of 
Reading; arrived at Springfield July 10, 1780; marched to camp July 11, 
1780, under command of Ensign Bancraft ; also, list of men raised for the 6 
months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed muster 
in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780; also, payroll for 6 months 
men raised by the town of Reading for service in the Continental Army 
during 1780 ; marched to camp July 5, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 27, 1780 ; .service, 

4 mos. 7 days, including travel (300 miles) home. 

Pool, Samuel. Capt. Brewer's co.. Col. Brewer's regt. ; return dated Camp Valley 
Forge, Jan. 23, 1778; reported deserted Jan. - [year not given]. 

Pool, Samuel. Private, Capt. Jesse Wyman's co'.. Col. Jacob Gerrish's regt. of 
guards; muster roll dated Bunker Hill, March 6, 1778; company detached to 
guard Lieut. Gen. Burgoyne's army; also, same co. and regt. ; enlisted Feb. 
21, 1778 ; service to May 18, 1778, 2 mos. 27 days, at Bunker Hill ; also, Capt. 
Nathaniel Cowdry's co., Col. Jacob Garish's (Gerrish's) regt. of guards; ser- 
vice from July 2 to July 16, 1778, 17 days, at Winter Hill. 

Pool, Samuel. Private, Capt. Abram Washburn's co.. Col. Theophilus Cotton's 
regt.; marched March 10, 1781; discharged April 1, 1781; service, 22 days; 
company marched to Newport to serve for 40 days. Roll dated Bridgewater.

Pool, Samuel. Carpenter's Yeoman, Continental frigate " Deane," commanded 
by Capt. Samuel Nicholson; engaged Feb. 25, 1782; service to May 31, 1782; 
term, 12 months; reported "Run." 

Pool, Simeon (also given Simon), Warwick. Receipt dated "Warwick, March 23, 
1781, for bounties paid said Pool and others by the town of Warwick to serve 
in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years ; also, descriptive list of men 
raised in Hampshire Co. to serve in the Continental Army, as returned by 
Noah Goodman, Superintendent; age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft.; complexion, 
light; hair, light; occupation, farmer; engaged for town of Warwick; en- 
gaged March 6, 1781 ; term, 3 years; also, receipt dated South Hadley, March 
7, 1781, signed by Noah Goodman, Superintendent for Hampshire Co., stating 
that he had received of Capt. Proctor said Pool, a recruit procured by Class 
No. 7 of the town of Warwick, to serve in the Continental Army for the term 
of 3 years; also, Private, Capt. Zebulon King's co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks's 
(7th) regt. ; muster rolls for Aiiril and May, 1781, dated West Point; also, 
muster rolls for June-Sept., 1781 ; also, muster rolls for Oct., Nov., and Dec, 
1781, and Jan., 1782, dated York Hutts ; also, muster roll for Feb., 1782, dated 
Hutts and sworn to at West Point; also, descriptive list dated Feb. 20, 1782; 
Capt. Zebulon King's co., Lieut. Col. J. Brooks's (7th) regt.; age, 17 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. (also given 5 ft. 2A in.) ; complexion, light; hair, brown ; occu- 
pation, laborer ; birthplace, Dighton ; residence, Warwick ; engaged for town 
of Warwick; engaged March 6, 1781; term, 3 years; also. Private, 5th co. ; 
entry dated Dec. 26, 1783, of an order for wages for May-Dec. [year not given], 
appearing in a register of orders accepted on account of wages, etc. 

Pool, Thomas, Casco Bay. Private, Capt. Samuel Johnson's co.. Col. Wiggles- 
worth's regt. ; pay abstract for travel allowance from Albany home, sworn to 
March 7, 1777 ; 300 miles travel allowed said Pool. 

Pool, Thomas, Falmouth (also given Bradford) . Private, Capt. Joseph Noyes's 
CO. ; enlisted July 11, 1775; service to Dec. 31, 1775, 6 mos. 5 days; company 
stationed at Falmouth, Cumberland Co., for defence of seacoast; also, return 
of men raised to serve in the Continental Army from Col. Peter Noyes's (1st 
Cumberland Co.) regt.; residence, Falmouth ; engaged for town of Falmouth 
(also given Bradford) ; joined Capt. Blaisdell's co.. Col. Wigglesworth's 
regt.; term, 3 years; also, list of men returned by a committee for settling 
disputes between towns as to soldiers credited to them [year not given] ; said 
Pool claimed by Falmouth and Bradford ; allowed to Bradford ; also. Ser- 
geant, Capt. Smart's co.. Col. Calvin Smith's regt.; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; residence, Bradford; 
credited to town of Bradford ; reported as serving 27 mos. as Private, 9 mos. 
as Sergeant; also, Capt. Nicholas Blasdel's co., Col. Edward Wigglesworth's 
regt.; return dated Camp Valley Forge, Feb. 5, 1778; mustered by Maj. 
Inslow, County Muster Master; also, Corporal, same co. and regt.; muster 
roll for May, 1778, dated Camp Valley Forge ; also, same co. and regt. ; mus- 
ter roll for June, 1778, dated Camp " Greeage ; " also, same co. and regt. ; pay 
roll for Oct., 1778, sworn to at Camp Providence; also, Capt. Blasdel's co., 
(late) Col. Wigglesworth's regt. ; muster roll for March and April, 1779, 
dated Providence; enlisted Jan. 1, 1777; reported promoted to Sergeant 
April 1, 1779.

regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 5 days ; reported 
returned home ; also, list of men belonging to the train band under Capt. John 
Walton, dated Reading, May 13, 1775.

Poor, . [This name also appears under the form of Pooar, Poore, Pore.] 

Poor, . General order dated Headquarters, Cambridge, July 22, 1775, making 

disposition of the forces about Boston and dividing the army into 3 grand 
divisions to consist of 2 brigades each ; said Poor, of New Hampshire, Colonel 
of a regiment assigned to a brigade to be commanded by Brig. Gen. Sullivan 
which was to form part of left wing, or 2d division, of the army under Maj. 
Gen. Lee, and to be stationed at Winter Hill. 

Poor, Abraham, Andover. Private, Capt. Thomas Poor's co. of Minute-men, 
Col. James Frye's regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; ser- 
vice to April 25, 1775, 7 days; reported enlisted Jan. 31, 1775; also, Capt. 
Thomas Poor's co., Col. James Frye's regt. ; return of men in camp at Cam- 
bridge, dated May 17, 1775. 

Poor, Abraham, Andover. Capt. William Hudson Ballard's co., Col. James 
Frye's regt. ; company return dated Cambridge, Oct. 6, 1775 ; reported absent ; 
also, 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Ballard's co. ; petition addressed to the Council, 
signed by James Brickett, Lieutenant Colonel, Col. James Frye's (1st) regt., 
stating that said Poor and other officers had been in camp from about July 14, 
1775, but had not received Continental commissions, and asking that they be 
recommended for such commissions ; ordered in Council Nov. 8, 1775, that the 
. officers named be recommended to His Excellency Gen. Washington ; also, 
order for bounty coat or its equivalent dated Cambridge, Nov. 24, 1775.

Poor, Amos, Newbury (also given Newburyport) . Private, Capt. Jacob Gerrish's 
CO., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 6 days; also, 
Capt. Jacob Gerrish's co., Col. Moses Little's (17th) regt. ; muster roll dated 
Prospect Hill, Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 24, 1775; service, 3 mos. 14 days; 
also, company return [probably Oct., 1775] ; age, 27yrs. ; also, Capt. Gerrish's 
CO., Col. Little's regt., Gen. Green's brigade; receipt for bounty coat dated 
Nov. 2, 1775 ; also, account showing sums of money to be paid from the public 
treasury to sundry persons for losses sustained at battles of Lexington and 
Bunker Hill ; amounts allowed in Council June 13, 1776 ; also, order on Henry 
Gardner, Treasurer, payable to Capt. Daniel Chute, dated Newbury, signed 
by said Poor, for money for losses sustained at battle of Bunker Hill, June 17, 
1775; also, Corporal, Capt. Joseph Ilsley's co., Col. Cogswell's regt. ; enlisted 
Sept. 30, 1776; discharged Nov. 16, 1776; service, 2 mos., including 13 days 
(260 miles) travel home ; roll dated Newcastle ; order for payment of amount 
of roll dated at North Castle and signed by Capt. Ilsley ; also, Capt. Moses 
Nowell's CO., Col. Titcomb's regt.; arrived at destination May 4, 1777; dis- 
chiirged July 4, 1777; service, 2 mos. 9 days, including 9 days (180 miles) 
travel out and home ; company marched to Rhode Island to serve for 2 months 
from time of arrival at Providence ; also. Sergeant, Capt. John Noyes's co., 
Col. Samuel Johnson's regt. ; entered service Aug. 14, 1777 ; discharged Nov. 
30, 1777 ; service, 3 mos. 28 days, in Northern department, including 12 days 
(240 miles) travel home ; also, 1st Lieutenant, Capt. Oliver Titcomb's co.. Col. 
Cogswell's regt. ; entered service Oct. 8, 1778 ; discharged Dec. 31, 1778 ; ser- 
vice, 2 mos. 25 days ; company detached to guard and fortify posts at and about 
Boston.

Poor, David, continued. 

1775 ; engaged April 24, 1775 ; service, 3 mos. 16 days ; also. Lieutenant, same 
CO. and regt. ; company return dated Camp at Winter Hill, Oct. 6, 1775; also. 
Lieutenant, Capt. Richardson's (5th) co. ; list of men taken from the Orderly 
Book of Col. Israel Hutchinson, of the 27th regt., dated Fort Lee; reported 
taken prisoner at Fort Washington Nov. 16, 1776; also, Lieutenant, Col. 
Hutchinson's regt. ; petition addressed to the Council, dated Boston, Aug. 
16, 1777, signed by Col. Israel Hutchinson, representing that certain officers 
who belonged to his regiment in 1776 and other officers not of his regiment 
were jirisoners at Long Island, and recommending that advance pay for 1 
month be sent to each officer; also, Lieutenant, (late) Col. Hutchinson's 
regt.; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Jan. 
4, 1781 ; reported a prisoner at New York ; also, petition dated Jan. 1, 1780, 
signed by said Poor, stating that he had engaged in the service of the United 
States April 17, 1775, and continued therein until captured at Fort Washing- 
ton in Nov., 1776, when he was taken to Long Island where he remained up- 
wards of four years ; that in consequence of his long absence in captivity his 
affairs had become greatly involved, and requesting as a measure of relief 
that pay be allowed him for a depreciation note.

10th Mass. regt. ; rank. Corporal ; age, 24 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complexion, 
light ; hair, dark ; residence, Newbury ; engaged April -, 1779, by Col. Tup- 
per; term, during war; also. Corporal, Col. Benjamin Tupper's (10th) regt. ; 
service from Jan. 1, 1781, 24 mos. ; reported reduced to Private Nov. 14, 1781.

enlisted Aug. 15, 1780; discharged Oct. 10, 1780; service, 2 mos. 7 days, 
including 10 days (214 miles) travel home ; regiment raised in Worcester Co. 
to serve for 3 months.

Pope, Edward. Official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated 
Feb. 7, 1776; said Pope chosen Colonel. 2d Bristol Co. regt. of Mass. militia; 
appointment concurred in by Council Feb. 8, 1776; reported commissioned 
Feb. 8, 1776 ; also, list of officers chosen in 2d Bristol Co. regt. of Mass. militia, 
as returned by said Pope and others, field officers, dated April 5, 1776 ; also, 
Colonel, 2d Bristol Co. regt. ; report dated July 9, 1776, of a meeting held by 
the 15th CO. to choose a Captain and 1st Lieutenant who were recommended 
for commissions by said Pope ; also, return dated Aug. 8, 1776, of officers of a 
company drafted from said Pope's regt. and Col. George Williams's (Bristol 
Co.) regt. to march to Dorchester Heights, agreeable to resolve of July 18, 1776, 
who were appointed by said Pope and field officers of both regiments ; also, 
official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated Nov. 23, 
1776 ; said Pope chosen Naval Officer for the port of Dartmouth ; appointment 
concurred in by Council Nov. 27, 1776; also. Colonel, 2d Bristol Co. regt.; 
marched Dec. 8, 1776 ; regiment marched to Rhode Island on an alarm ; also, 
account of blank commissions delivered the committees appointed to raise men 
to go to Canada [year not given J ; said Pope reported as belonging to committee 
for Bristol Co. ; also, official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, 
dated Jan. 24, 1778 ; said Pope chosen Naval Officer for the port of Dartmouth 
for the ensuing year ; appointment concurred in by Council Jan. 27, 1778 ; also, 
petition addressed to the Council, dated June 5, 1778, signed by said Pope, stat- 
ing that he had been appointed Colonel of 2d Bristol Co. regt. of Mass. militia 
in 1776, and had performed the duties of the office to the best of his ability, 
but inasmuch as his business took him from home and prevented him from 
attending to the 'business of his command with that punctuality that the 
exigencies of the time required, asking that his resignation be accepted; 
resignation accepted in Council June 5, 1778 ; also, official record of a ballot 
by the House of Representatives, dated Feb. 5, 1779 ; said Pope chosen Naval 
Officer for the port of Dartmouth ; appointment concurred in by Council Feb. 
6, 1779 ; also, official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated 
Jan. 5, 1780 ; said Pope chosen Naval Officer for the port of Dartmouth for the 
year 1780; appointment concurred in by Council Jan. 5, 1780.

Pope, William. Private, Capt. Joseph Bellows's co. ; marched Aug. 22, 1777 ;

at Bennington, under command of Maj. Ebenezer Bridge, at request of Gen. 
Stark and Col. Warner, and was discharged by Gen. Lincoln after proceeding 
90 miles.

Porter, . Communication addressed to the Council, dated Verplanck's Point, 

Oct. 15, 1782, signed by M. Jackson, Colonel, 8th Mass. regt., stating the 
necessity of appointing a Lieutenant Colonel in his regiment, and recom- 
mending Maj. Hugh Maxwell for the position, as said Porter, the senior 
Major of the line, had been dismissed the service, his sentence having been 
approved by Gen. Washington Oct. 12, 1782. 

Porter, Aaron, Beverly. List of men mustered by Nathaniel Barber, Muster

Porter, Isaac. Private, Capt. Nathan Packard's co.. Col. Thomas Carpenter's 
regt. ; entered service July 25, 1778 ; discharged Sept. 9, 1778 ; service, 1 mo. 
16 days, at Rhode Island. Roll sworn to at Plymouth. 

Porter, Israel, Cambridge (probably). Private, Capt. Samuel Thatcher's co. of 
militia. Col. Gardner's regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; 
service, 3 days; also, list dated Cambridge, July 8, 1776, of men who served 
or hired men to serve in the Continental Army in Northern department ; 
said Porter with Benjamin Butterfield reported as having hired John Dor- 
ring ; also, list dated Cambridge, July -, 1776, of men who served on the 
exiiedition to Canada; said Porter with Benjamin Butterfield credited with 
1 turn of service [name crossed out on list] ; also, list of men attached to a 
warrant from Capt. John "Walton to Sergt. Joseph B.ates, dated Aug. 4, 1777, 
directing him, in consequence of orders received from Col. Thatcher, to warn 
the train band of said Walton's co. to be ready at a moment's notice to march 
with 6 days provisions, and to make return of the deficiencies of equipments. 

Porter, Jacob, Abington. Sergeant, Capt. Nathan Snow's co. commanded by 2d 
Lieut. Christopher Dyer, Col. Edward Mitchel's regt.. Gen. Cushing's bri- 
gade ; marched Dec. 9, 1776; service, 1 week; company marched to Bristol, 
R. I., on an alarm. 

Porter, Jacob, Littleton. Corporal, Capt. Samuel Reed's co. of Minute-men, 
Col. William Prescott's regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; 
service, 6 days; reported enlisted into the army ; also. Sergeant, Capt. Samuel 
Gilbert's co., Col. William Prescott's regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; 
enlisted April 24, 1775; service, 98 days; also, company return dated Cam- 
bridge, Sept. 28, 1775; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money 
dated Cambridge, Oct. 30, 1775. 

P©rter, Jacob, Weymouth. Capt. Asa White's co. ; return for equipments, dated 
Weymouth, March 20, 1775; also. Private, Capt. Jacob Goold's co.. Col. Grea- 
ton's regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 27, 1775; service, 
13 weeks 5 days; also, Capt. Goold's co., 36th regt.; company return dated 
Fort No. 2, Cambridge [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, Capt. Goold's co.. Col. 
John Greaton's regt. ; order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated 
Cambridge, Dec. 12, 1775. 

Porter, Jacob. Sergeant, Capt. Calvin Partridge's co.. Col. John Cushing's 
regt.; drafted Sept. 20, 1776; service, 60 days; company marched to Rhode 
Island. 

Porter, Jacob. Statement dated Boston, Sept. 22, 1777, signed by said Porter and 
others belonging to Col. Crafts's regt., declaring their refusal to leave Boston 
unless their bounty or wages, or both, were made equivalent to those allowed 
, the soldiers of the Continental train of artillery ; also, petition addressed to 
Col. Thomas Crafts, dated Camp at Boston, Sept. 25, 1777, signed by said Por- 
ter and others, requesting that the objectionable part of their former jjetition, 
which was considered mutinous, be stricken out, and asking that the ser- 
geants of the regiment confined on account of the petition be released ; also, 
Gunner, Capt. Philip Marett's (5th) co., Col. Thomas Crafts's (Artillery) 
regt. ; service from May 7, 1777, to Aug. 1, 1777, 84 days ; roll sworn to at Bos- 
ton ; also, Capt. Joseph Balch's co.. Col. Crafts's regt.; list of men who 
received bounty from April 30, 1777, to Dec. 30, 1777, 8 mos. ; also, Bombar- 
dier, Capt. Warner's co.. Col. Revere's (Artillery) regt.; Continental Army 
pay accounts for service from July 10, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779 ; also, (late) Capt. 
Jonathan Warner's (3d) co., corps of artillery formerly commanded by Lieut. 
Col. Paul Revere ; service from Jan. 1, 1780, to May 8, 1780, 4 mos. 8 days.

Porter, Jacob. Private, Capt. Rufus Barney's co., Col. Carpenter's regt. ; ser- 
vice, 4 days, on an alarm; company detached to march to Tiverton, R. I., 
July 28, 1780, for 6 days service. 

Porter, Jacob. Capt. Nehemiah Pratt's co.. Col. Mitchell's regt. commanded by 
Lieut. Col. James Williams, Brig. George Godfrey's (Bristol Co.) brigade; 
service, 8 days ; company marched to Tiverton, R. I., on the alarm of Aug. 2, 
1780. 

Porter, James, Danvers. Private, Capt. Israel Hutchinson's co. of Minute-men, 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; service, 2 days; also, Capt. 
Ebenezer Francis's CO., Col. John Mansfield's regt.; order for advance pay, 
signed by said Porter and others, dated Cambridge, June 22, 1775 ; reported 
as having taken the oath in Middlesex Co. June 22, 1775, required by Con- 
gress to be taken by the Mass. army; also, Private, same co. and regt. ; mus- 
ter roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 4, 1775; service, 3 mos. 5 days; also, 
Capt. Francis's co., Col. Mansfield's (19th) regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. 
Israel Hutchinson ; company return dated Oct. 6, 1775; also, order for bounty 
coat or its equivalent in money dated Winter Hill, Oct. 26, 1775. 

Porter, James. Private, Capt. Henry Peirce's co., Col. Theophilus Cotton's 
regt. ; enlisted March 8, 1781 ; discharged March 31, 1781 ; service, 26 days, at 
Rhode Island, including travel (65 miles) out and home; company raised by 
order of His Excellency John Hancock to serve for 40 days, unless sooner 
discharged. 

Porter, Jesse, Sunderland. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army, 
as returned by Capt. Caleb Montague; residence, Sunderland; engaged for 
town of Sunderland; joined Capt. Luke Day's co.. Col. Alden's regt.; term, 
during war; also, Private, Capt. Luke Day's co.. Col. Ichabod Alden's regt. ; 
return dated Jan. 11, 1778; mustered by Ruggles Woodbridge, Muster Master 
for Hampshire Co., and by a Continental Muster Master ; reported died Dec. 
21,1777. [See Jesse Proser.] 

PoRTERj Job, Shelburne. Private, Capt. Agrippa Wells's co., Col. Asa Whit- 
comb's regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted May 10, 1775; service, 
1 mo. 9 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775J ; reported died June 
16, 1775; also, order on the Committee of Clothing, payable to Capt. Agrippa 
Wells, dated Shelburne, Jan. 28, 1776, signed by the Selectmen, for money 
for the use of Mary Porter, widow of said Porter, deceased, in lieu of a bounty 
coat due him. 

Porter, Joel, Groton. Private, Capt. Josiah Sartell's co., which marched on 
the alarm of April 19, 1775, from Groton to headquarters at Cambridge ; 
service, 9 days. 

Porter, Joel, Groton. Private, Capt. Asa Lawrence's co. of Minute-men, which 
marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775, to headquarters at Cambridge; ser- 
vice, 6 days ; reported enlisted into the army ; also, Capt. Asa Lawrence's 
CO., Col. William Prescott's regt.; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted 
April 25, 1775; service, 3 mos. 8 days; also, company return dated Oct. 7, 
1775; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Cambridge, 
Oct. 30, 1775; also, account showing sums of money to be paid from the pub- 
lic treasury to sundry persons for losses sustained at battles of Lexington and 
Bunker Hill ; amounts allowed in Council June 13, 1776.

travel home; regiment raised to fortify passes of North river, N. Y. ; also, 
Capt. Asa Lawrance's co.. Col. Poor's regt.; payrolls for June-Aug., 1778,

Porter, Joel. Receipt dated Boston, June 25, 1782, for bounty paid said Porter 

by Capt. Silas Alden, Chairman of Class No. 3 of the town of Needham, to 

serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years. 

Porter, John, Abington. Private, Capt. Edward Cobb's co., Col. Edward 
Mitchel's regt.; service, 5 days; company marched from Abington to " The 
Farms" in Braintree March 4, 1776; also, Capt. Nathan Snow's co. com- 
manded by 2d Lieut. Christopher Dyer, Col. Mitchel's regt.. Gen. Cushing's 
brigade ; marched Dec. 9, 1776 ; service, 2 weeks 2 days ; company marched to 
Bristol, R. I., on an alarm; also, Capt. James Allen's co., in a regiment 
commanded by Maj. Eliphalet Cary; service, 23 days; company stationed at 
Bristol, R. I., April 19, 1777. 

Porter, John, Bridgewater. Captain, Col. Paul Dudley Sargent's (28th) regt. ; 
muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; engaged June 29, 1775 ; service, 1 mo. 12 days ; 
also, company return dated Camp before Boston, Oct. 6, 1775. 

Porter, John, Danbury. Capt. James Horton's co., commanded by Capt. Stephen 
Osborn from May 1, 1778, to May 31, 1779, Col. Baldwin's regt. of artificers; 
copy of a company return, dated July 20, 1780 ; engaged March 11, 1779 ; term, 
during war ; company reported as belonging to Connecticut. 

Porter, John, Ipswich. Private, Capt. Thomas Burnham's co., which marched 
on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 3 days ; also, Capt. Abraham Dodge's 
CO., Col. Moses Little's (17th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted 
May 3, 1775 ; service, 12 weeks 6 days ; also, company return endorsed " Octo- 
ber the 9 1775; " age, 32 yrs. ; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent in 
money dated Dec. 21, 1775. 

Porter, John, Lincoln. List of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
[year not given] ; residence, Lincoln ; engaged for town of Lincoln. 

Porter, John, Littleton. Sergeant, Lieut. Aquila Jewett's co. of militia, Col. 
James Prescott's regt., which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775; ser- 
vice, 14 days; also. Lieutenant, Capt. Jonathan Minott's co., Col. Baldwin's 
regt. ; pay abstract for mileage from home to headquarters and return, dated 
Cambridge, Jan. 12, 1776; mileage for 54 miles allowed said Porter; also, re- 
turn signed by Col. Jonathan Reed, of 6th Middlesex Co. regt. of Mass. militia, 
stating that said Porter, Captain, had been chosen Adjutant of said regiment 
at a meeting of the field officers at Groton, March 11, 1776; also, official 
record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated April 22, 1776; said 
Porter chosen Adjutant, 6th Middlesex Co. regt. of Mass. militia; appoint- 
ment concurred in by Council April 23, 1776 ; reported commissioned April 23, 
1776; also, 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Joshua Parker's co., Col. Jonathan Reed's 
regt.; rations allowed from July 11, 1776, to Nov. 30, 1776; credited with 143 
days allowance ; reported acting as Adjutant ; «?so. Adjutant, same regt. ; pay 
abstract for rations and travel allowance home, dated Boston, March 10, 1777 ; 
service with Northern army ; 173 miles travel allowed said Porter ; also, Lieu- 
tenant, Capt. John Minot's co.. Col. Josiah Whitney's regt.; arrived at 
destination May 10, 1777 ; discharged July 9, 1777 ; service, 2 mos. 9 days, at 
Rhode Island, including travel (8 days) to and from place of destination ; roll 
dated Warwick Neck ; also. Adjutant, Col. Samuel Bullard's regt.. Gen. 
Warner's brigade ; engaged Aug. 14, 1777; discharged Nov. 30,1777; service, 
3 mos. 27 days, at the capitulation of Gen. Burgoyne, including 11 days (220 
miles) travel home; said Porter allowed horse rations for 120 days; also,

April 2, 1778 ; also. Captain ; list of officers appointed to command men 
detached from militia to reinforce the Continental Army, agreeable to resolve 
of Oct. 9, 1779; said Porter detached from 6th Middlesex Co. regt. ; commis- 
sioned Oct. 20, 1779; also. Captain, Col. Samuel Denny's (2d) regt.; engaged 
Oct. 12, 1779; discharged Nov. 23, 1779; service, 1 mo. 22 days, at Claverack, 
including 10 days (200 miles) travel home; regiment raised for 3 months; also,

reinforce Continental Army for 3 months, agreeable to resolve of June 22, 
1780; said Porter detached from Middlesex Co. militia; commissioned Aug. 
7, 1780; also. Captain, Col. Cyprian How's regt.. Col. Commandant John 
Jacobs's brigade; discharged Oct. 30, 1780; service, 4 mos. 7 days, at Rhode 
Island, including travel (80 miles) home ; regiment raised for 3 months; also. 
Major, Lieut. Col. Joseph Webb's regt.; detached Aug. 3, 1781; discharged 
Dec. 2, 1781; service, 4 mos. 10 days, including 11 days (220 miles) travel 
home ; regiment raised to reinforce Continental Army for 3 months and sta- 
tioned at Peekskill. 

Porter, John, Marblehead. Private, Capt. Jeremiah Putnam's co.. Col. Nathan 
Tyler's regt. ; enlisted July 25, 1779; service to Dec. 1, 1779, 4 mos. 6 days, at 
Rhode Island; also, same co. and regt.; pay roll for Dec, 1779, allowing 1 
mo. 5 days service at Rhode Island, travel (95 miles) included.

Leonard's co., Lieut. Col. Timothy Robbinson's detachment from 3d Hamp- 
shire Co. regt., which marched to reinforce Northern army; marched Oct. 21, 
1776; service, 28 days, including travel (160 miles) home. 

Porter, John, West Springfield. Lieutenant, Capt. Thomas Stebbing's co. ; 
return dated Jan. 18, 1776, of officers and men of militia companies which 
joined Col. Ebenezer Learned's regt. to serve until the last of Jan., 1776; 
also. Lieutenant, Capt. Thomas Stebbins's co. ; return dated Roxbury Camp, 
Jan. 18, 1776, of officers and men of militia companies which joined Col. 
Ebenezer Learned's regt. ; company raised in Springfield, West Springfield, 
and Wilbraham, and comprised 68 men ; ordered in Council Feb. 1, 1776, that 
officers of such companies as contained 64 men or upwards be commissioned ; 
reported commissioned Feb. 1, 1776; also. Lieutenant, Capt. Nathan Rowle's 
CO., Col. John Mosley's regt.; engaged Sept. 21, 1777; discharged Oct. 17, 
1777 ; service, 1 mo. 3 days, on expedition to Northern department.

an order of Council of Nov. 21, 1776, and marched them into the Lines in the 
town of Beverly; certificate endorsed " Seacoast Company."

Porter, John. Petition dated March 29, 1779, signed by- George Cabot, in behalf 
of himself and others, of Beverly, asking that said Porter be commissioned
