Porter, John, continued. 

as commander of the brigantine " Experiment " (privateer) , intended to trade 
with the West Indies ; ordered in Council March 30, 1779, that a commission 
be issued ; also, petition dated Boston, Nov. 14, 1782, signed by Daniel Pils- 
bury, in behalf of himself and others, of Boston, asking that said Porter be 
commissioned as commander of the schooner " Fox " (privateer) ; advised in 
Council Nov. 15, 1782, that a commission be issued. 

Porter, John. Certificate dated Cambridge, Jan. 31, 1776, signed by Maj. James 
"Wesson, certifying that a company of militia commanded by said Porter, 
Captain, had served from Jan. 15, 1776, in that part of Col. Baldwin's regt. 
commanded by said Wesson, stationed at No. 1, Cambridge, and that the 
ofiQcers were faithful and efficient in the performance of their duties ; 
ordered in Council Feb. 2, 1776, that said officers be commissioned; also, 
Captain ; list of officers of a company of militia which joined the army as a 
temporary reinforcement under Maj. James Wesson ; commissioned Feb. 2, 
1776; also, official record of a ballot by the House of Representatives, dated 
June 11, 1777 ; said Porter, Captain, chosen Major, Col. Wigglesworth's regt., 
in place of Maj. Cranson, deceased ; appointment concurred in by Council 
June 11, 1777; reported commissioned May .S0[?], 1777; also. Major, Col. 
Calvin Smith's regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from May 30, 
1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also. Major, Col. Edward Wigglesworth's (4th) regt. ;

Salem, Aug. 28, 1779; also. Major; list of settlements of rank of Continental

Col. Smith's regt.; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 
1780, to Dec. 31, 1780 ; reported acting as Brigade Inspector ; also, muster rolls

Porter.

620 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AXD SAILORS 

Potter, Asa, Ipswich. List of deserters from Col. Jolin Bailey's (2d) regt. sub- 
sequent to Jan. 1, 1777; birthplace, Ipswich ; residence, Ipswich ; enlistment, 
3 years; reported deserted Feb. 15, 1777. [See Asa Porter.] 

Potter, Barnabas, Brookfield. Corporal, Capt. John Packhard's co.. Col. David 
Brewer's {9th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 2, 1775 ; 
service, 3 mos. 6 days ; aim, company return dated Roxbury Camp, Oct. 7, 
1775; also, Capt. Packard's co.. Col. Rufus Putnam's (late Brewer's) regt.; 
order for bounty coat or its equivalent in money dated Roxbury, Dec. 27, 
1775; also, Private, Capt. Nathan Hamilton's co.. Col. Samuel Brewer's 
regt. ; service from Aug. 3, 1776, to Sept. 30, 1776, 1 mo. 29 (also given 1 mo. 
28) days; also, same co. ; company receipt for wages for Oct., 1776, dated 
Ticonderoga Mills ; also, Capt. Hamilton's co., Col. Brewer's regt. ; pay ab- 
stract for travel allowance, etc., dated Brookfield, Feb. 17, 1777 ; 160 miles 
travel allowed said Potter ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay abstract for travel 
allowance, etc., home from Fort Edward, dated Brookfield, Feb. 6, 1777; said 
Potter credited with allowance for 8^ days (170 miles) travel; also, list ot 
men mvistered to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 9 months; 
said Potter appears among men belonging to Capt. Gilbert's co. and other 
companies in Col. Converse's regt. ; engaged for town of Brookfield ; mus- 
tered May 19 [year not given, probably 1778] ; also, descriptive list of men 
raised for Continental service, as returned by Seth Washbvirn, Superintendent 
for Worcester Co.; Capt. Gilbert's co.. Col. Converse's regt.; age, 27 yrs. ; 
stature, 5 ft. 11 in.; complexion, dark; residence, Brookfield; arrived at 
Fishkill June 7, 1778 ; also, list of men returned as received of Jonathan 
Warner, Commissioner, by Col. R. Putnam, July 20, 1778; enlistment, dur- 
ing war ; also, list of men returned as mustered by Henry Rutgers, Jr., Deputy 
Muster Master, dated Fishkill, Aug. 1, 1778; also, declaration dated Brook- 
field, Aug. 3, 1778, signed by Daniel Gilbert, Captain of a company of North 
Precinct in Brookfield, stating that he had enlisted said Potter and others in 
May, 1778, to serve for the term of 9 months under Gen. Washington and 
that they were enlisted in time to entitle them to receive the gratuity allowed 
by a resolve of the General Court. 

Potter, Barnabas, Goshen. List of men transferred from Capt. Turner's co., 
9th Mass. regt., to 3d co., 3d Mass. regt., dated Dec. 14, 1782; rank. Private; 
enlisted May 14, 1782; enlistment, 3 years; also. Private, Capt. James Tis- 
dale's (3d) co., 3d Mass. regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. James Mellin ; 
muster rolls for Jan. and Feb., 1783; also, Capt. Tisdale's (4th) co., 3d Mass. 
regt. commanded by Col. Michael Jackson ; muster roll for Aug. and Sept., 
1783; balance of term of enlistment unexpired, 21 months 29 days; also, 
descriptive list of men in Continental service ; Capt. James Tisdale's (4th) 
CO., 3d Mass. regt. commanded by Lieut. Col. Millin ; age, 26 yrs. ; stature, 
5 ft. 11 in.; complexion, light ; hair, light; occupation, bricklayer ; residence, 
Goshen; engaged for town of Groton ; engaged May 18, 1782; term, 3 years; 
reported as having received clothing on various dates between Dec. 14, 1782, 
and Dec. 16, 1783. 

Potter, Barnabas. Private, Capt. Hughes's co.. Col. Hazen's regt. ; Continental 
Army pay accounts for service from June 10, 1778, to Dec. 25, 1778; also, 
return of officers and men belonging to Massachusetts in Col. Moses Hazen's 
regt., certified at Camp Peekskill, Nov. 9, 1779; Capt. Hughes's co. ; rank. 
Private; enlisted June 10, 1778; enlistment, during war; reported deserted 
Dec. 25, 1778. 

Potter, Barnabas. Receipt dated Springfield, June 3, 1782, for bounty paid said 
Potter by Samuel Clark, Chairman of Class No. 3 of the town of Northampton, 
to serve in the Continental Army for the term of 3 years. 



IN THE WAR OF THE REVOLUTION. 621 

Potter, Benjamin, Shelburne. Private, Capt. Lawrence Kemp's co., Col. 
Leonard's regt. ; enlisted Feb. 23, 1777; discharged April 10, 1777; service, 
47 days, at Ticonderoga ; also, receipt given to the Selectmen of Shelburne, 
dated Sept. 22, 1777, signed by said Potter and others, for mileage, etc, from 
Shelburne to Stillwater, 112 miles; Capt. John Wells certifies that the men 
whose names appear upon the above receipt went out of the town with liim ; 
also, Capt. John Wells's co. of Hampshire Co. militia ; entered service Sept. 
22, 1777; discharged Oct. 23, 1777; service, 1 mo. 2 days, under Col. David 
Wells in Northern department ; also, list of men raised to serve in the Conti- 
nental Army, as returned by Lieut. Benjamin Nash ; residence, Shelburne ; 
engaged for town of Shelburne ; joined Capt. Bryant's co.. Col. Crane's regt. ; 
term, 3 years; also, Matross, Capt. Bryant's co.. Col. Mason's regt.; Conti- 
nental Army pay accounts for service from March 27, 1778, to Dec. 31, 1779; 
also, Capt. Benjamin Frothingham's co., Col. John Crane's regt. ; muster roll 
for Oct., 1778, dated Springfield ; reported sick and absent ; also, return dated 
Springfield, Nov. 1, 1779, of matrosses belonging to Capt. Benjamin Froth- 
ingham's CO., Col. John Crane's (Artillery) regt., being part of the quota of 
Massachusetts for the year 1779, who were entitled to the gratuity from the 
State ; above men certified as having enlisted for 3 years or during the war 
and as being in actual service at date of return ; company stationed at Spring- 
field ; also, Capt. Bryant's co. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service 
from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; company stationed at West Point. 

Potter, Benjamin, Upton. Corporal, Capt. Stephen Sadler's co., Col. Wheelock's 
regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in response to the alarm of April 19, 1775, 
to Roxbury ; service, 5 days. 

Potter, Benjamin. Private, Capt. Benjamin Farrer's co., 3d Worcester Co. regt. 
commanded by Lieut. Col. Nathan Tyler ; enlisted Dec. 8, 1776 ; discharged 
Jan. 21, 1777; service, 1 mo. 14 days, at Providence; company marched to 
Rhode Island on the alarm of Dec. 8, 1776. 

Potter, Benjamin. Sergeant, Capt. Isaac Martin's co.. Col. Ezra Wood's regt. ; 
service, 23 days ; company marched to Rhode Island April 17, 1777, and served 
until May 7, 1777, under Maj. Gen. Spencer. 

Potter, Benjamin. Sergeant, Capt. Robert Taft's co. ; list of men who enlisted 
Aug. 21, 1777, on the alarm caused by the battle of Bennington [service not 
given]. 

Potter, Benjamin. Private, Capt. Benjamin Munroe's co. ; entered service Jan. 
2 [1778] ; service, 3 mos. ; said Potter appears as having received utensils at 
Quidneset, North Kingston, Jan. 20, 1778; also, receipt dated Stow, July 2, 
1779, signed by said Potter and others, for wages and rations received of Capt. 
Benjamin Munroe for service in his company. Col. Sprout's regt., at Rhode 
Island in 1778. [The foregoing appear among orders, returns, etc., taken from 
Capt. Benjamin Munroe's papers.] 

Potter, Benjamin. Private, Capt. Thomas Marshall Baker's co.. Col. Nathan 
Tyler's regt.; enlisted July 27, 1780; discharged Aug. 8, 1780; service, 15 
days, including 3 days (60 miles) travel home ; company marched to Rhode 
Island on an alarm.

Potter, Ephraim, Brookfield. List of men raised in 1777 to serve in the Continen- 
tal Army, as returned by Capt. Daniel Gilbert ; residence, Brookfield ; 
engaged for town of Brookfield; joined Capt. Goodale's co., Col. Putnam's 
regt. ; term, 3 years; also, list of men raised to serve in the Continental Army 
from Col. James Converse's (4th Worcester Co.) regt. ; aiso, list of men mus- 
tered by Thomas Newhall, Muster Master for Worcester Co. ; Capt. Goodale's 
CO., Col. Putnam's regt.; mustered April 10, 1777; term, during war; also, 
Corporal, Maj. Allen's co., Col. Putnam's regt. ; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from Feb. 3, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779 ; reported as serving 9 
mos. 4 days as Corporal, 25 mos. 24 days as Sergeant; also, Sergeant, Capt. 
Nathan Goodale's co.. Col. Rufus Putnam's (4th) regt. ; return dated Albany, 
Feb. 9, 1778; mustered by Capt. Newhall ; also, Capt. Goodale's co.. Col. Put- 
nam's (5th) regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 
1780, to Dec. 31, 1780; also, descriptive list dated West Point, Jan. 10, 1781; 
Capt. Goodale's co., Col. Putnam's (5th) regt.; rank. Sergeant; age, 26 yrs. 
5 mos. ; stature, 5 ft. 10.\ in. ; complexion, light; hair, dark ; eyes, dark ; resi- 
dence, Brookfield ; enlisted Feb. 3, 1777, by Capt. Goodale ; enlistment, dur- 
ing war; also, Sergeant. Capt. Nathan Goodale's co.. Col. Putnam's regt.; 
muster roll for Jan., 1781 ; also, muster rolls for Feb. and March, 1781, dated 
Garrison West Point ; reported transferred to Capt. Smith's co. April 1,1781 ; 
also, Sergeant Major, Capt. Sylvanus Smith's co.. Col. Rufus Putnam's regt. ; 
muster rolls for Feb.-May, 1781, sworn to in Garrison at West Point ; reported 
transferred to Capt. Goodale's co. June 1, 1781.

Potter, Ephbaim. Private, Capt. Benjamin Phillips's co., Lieut. Col. Timothy 
Robinson's detachment of Hampshire Co. militia; muster roll dated Garri- 
son at Ticouderoga, Feb. 24, 1777 ; enlistment to expire March 23, 1777 ; also, 
same co. and detachment; enlisted Jan. 11, 1777; discharged April 1, 1778; 
service, 81 days; company marched to Ticonderoga. 

Potter, Ephraim. Returns for provisions from March 13, 1779, to April 10, 1779, 
from July 7, 1779, to Sept. 25, 1779, and from March 25, 1780, to May 6, 1780, 
dated Boston, of men employed under Col. William Burbeck at the Labo- 
ratory. 

Potter, Ephraim. Statement dated Boston, Sept. 22, 1777, signed by said Potter 
and others belonging to Col. Crafts's regt., declaring their refusal to leave 
Boston, unless their bounty or wages, or both, were made equivalent to those 
allowed the soldiers of the Continental train of artillery; also, petition ad- 
dressed to Col. Thomas Crafts, dated Camp at Boston, Sept. 25, 1777, signed 
by said Potter and others, requesting that the objectionable part of their 
former petition, which was considered mutinous, be stricken out, and asking 
that the sergeants of the regiment confined on account of the petition be re- 
leased ; also. Sergeant, Capt. David Bradlee's (9th) co.. Col. Thomas Crafts's 
(Artillery) regt. ; service from time of enlistment to Oct. 1, 1777, 4 mos. 10 
days ; also, same co. and regt. ; return of men entitled to an additional bounty 
of £15, dated Boston, Jan. 12, 1778; also, same co. and regt. ; list of men who 
received bounty from April 30, 1777, to Dec. 30, 1777, 8 mos. ; also, Matross, 
Capt. Warner's co.. Col. Revere's (Artillery) regt.; Continental Army pay 
accounts for service from May 20, 1777, to Dec. 31, 1779; also, (late) Capt. 
Jonathan Warner's (3d) co., corps of artillery formerly commanded by Lieut. 
Col. Paul Revere ; service from Jan. 1, 1780, to May 8, 1780, 4 mos. 8 days.

the first Everidge ; " said Potter appears among men with Capt. Abishai 
Brown at Nantasket [year not given].

on the alarm of April 19, 1775, from West Parish in Ipswich ; service, 1 day. 

Potter, George. Private, Capt. Elijah Lewis's co.. Col. Christopher Greene's 
(1st Rhode Island) battalion; muster roll for Jan.-Nov., 1777; enlisted 
March 13 [year not given]; enlistment, during war; fl/.50, muster rolls for 
Jan.-April, 1778; reported sick in hospital in March, 1778, sick and absent 
at French Creek in April, 1778; also, Corporal, Capt. Lewis's (3d) co.. Col. 
Greene's battalion ; muster rolls for July, Aug., and Oct., 1779, dated East 
Greenwich ; joined July 3, 1779 ; term, 3 years ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay

on Penobscot expedition ; vessel reported lost. Roll sworn to in Suffolk Co.

for Sept., 1781-March, 1782; reported on command with Col. Scammell in 
Sept., 1781, sick at Philadelphia in Oct. and Nov., 1781, sick in hospital in 
Jan., 1782, died at West Point, March 21, 1782.

Powers, Isaac, Greenwich. Captain, 1st Greenwich co., 4th Hampshire Co. regt.

commissioned; reported commissioned April 1, 1776; also, Captain, 6th co.. 
Col. Elisha Porter's (4th Hampshire Co.) regt. of Mass. militia ; list of officers, 
certified by Brig. Gen. T. Danielson April 18, 1780, as having been previously 
certified to the Council by Col. Porter for resignations on the ground that such 
a course would be for the good of the service and suggesting that action be 
taken in the matter ; ordered in Council April 18, 1780, that the resignations 
of said officers be accepted.

1780, under command of Ensign Joseph Miller ; also, list of men raised for the 
6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. Paterson as having passed mus- 
ter in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 1780 ; also, receipt dated Worces- 
ter, June 18, 1782, for bounty paid said Pratt by Abijah Tainter, Chairman of 
Class No. 10 of the town of Sutton, to serve in the Continental Army for the 
term of 3 years.

Pratt, David, Boston. Matross, Capt. Joseph Balch's (3cl) co., Col. Thomas 
Crafts's (Artillery) regt. ; service between Nov. 1, 1776, and Feb. 1, 1777, 
1 mo.; also, Capt. Joseph Balch's (2d) co.. Col. Crafts's (Artillery) regt.; 
service from Feb. 1, 1777, to May 8, 1777, 3 mos. 7 days; also, statement dated 
Boston, Sept. 22, 1777, signed by said Pratt and others belonging to Col. 
Crafts's regt., declaring their refusal to leave Boston unless their bounty or 
wages, or both, were made equivalent to those allowed the soldiers of the 
Continental train of artillery ; also, petition addressed to Col. Thomas Crafts, 
dated Camp at Boston, Sept. 25, 1777, signed by said Pratt and others, request- 
ing that the objectionable part of their former petition, which was considered 
mutinous, be stricken out, and asking that the sergeants of the regiment con- 
fined on account of the petition be released; also, Capt. Balch's (1st) co.. Col. 
Crafts's regt. ; service from time of enlistment to Oct. 1, 1777, 120 days; also, 
same co. and regt. ; list of men entitled to an additional bounty of £15, as re- 
turned by Col. T. Crafts, dated Boston, Jan. 12, 1778 ; also, same co. and regt. ; 
list of men who received bounty from April 30, 1777, to Dec. 30, 1777, 8 mos. ; 
also, Matross, (late) Capt. Jonathan Warner's (3d) co., corps of artillery for- 
merly commanded by Lieut. Col. Paul Revere; service from Jan. 1, 1780, to 
May 8, 1780, 4 mos. 8 days.

age, 25 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 9 in. ; complexion, light ; engaged for town of Read- 
ing ; marched to camp July 17, 1780, under command of Capt. Abner Howard ; 
also, list of men raised for the 6 months service and returned by Brig. Gen. 
Paterson as having passed muster in a return dated Camp Totoway, Oct. 25, 
1780; also, pay roll for 6 months men raised by the town of Reading for ser- 
vice in the Continental Army during 1780; marched to camp July 13, 1780; 
discharged Dec. 7, 1780; service, 5 mos. 6 days, including travel (240 miles) 
home.

home. Roll sworn to at Dedham.

Pratt, Ephraim. Return of recruits sent by state of Massachusetts as portion of

Hill, dated Oxford, March 8, 1784, signed by said Pratt, for wages and cloth- 
ing allowance due for service in the Continental Army.

poral, Capt. Stephen Penniman's co., Col. Dike's regt. ; muster roll for Dec, 
1776-Feb., 1777; enlisted Dec. 13, 1776; regiment raised to serve until March 
1, 1777. 

Pratt, Jesse, Medfield. Private, Capt. Sabin Man's co. of Minute-men, Col.

days; reported returned home ; company raised in Medfield and Walpole.

Pratt discharged Oct. 23, 1776.

service, 2 days.

Pratt, Jesse. Return of non-commissioned officers chosen in Capt. Sabin Mann's 
CO. of Medfield militia, agreeable to warrant dated May 15, 1776; said Pratt 
chosen Corporal; also, Medfield militia records; entry dated May 24, 1776, 
signed by Capt. Sabin Mann, being copy of a warrant directing said Pratt, 
and other Corporals of his company, to warn men belonging to training band 
to assemble completely equipped " Monday next " at 8 a.m. at the old Meeting 
House for military exerci.se ; also to warn men to hold themselves in readi- 
ness to march at short notice in case of an alarm, appointing the alarm post, 
and describing the alarm signal; also, Capt. Mann's co. of Medfield militia; 
return of train band with equipments, dated June 10, 1776; age, 24 yrs.; re- 
ported as in the army July -, 1776; also reported deceased.

Pratt, John. Return of sentences by a general court martial of 1st and 2d bri- 
gades, Lieut. Col. March, President, appearing in a general order dated Head- 
quarters, Ticonderoga, Oct. 13, 1776, taken from Col. Ephraim Wheelock's 
Orderly Book ; said Pratt, Ensign, Col. Greaton's (24th) regt., tried on charge 
of acting as sutler and selling rum in camp, found guilty, and sentenced to 
forfeit one month's pay for the benefit of the sick of the regiment and to be 
dismissed the service with infamy.

vice from Sept. 28, 1777, to Oct. 31, 1777, 35 days, at Rhode Island on a secret 
expedition. 

Pratt, Levi. Private, Capt. James Endicott's co. ; enlisted March 20, 1778 ; dis-

Pratt, Levi. Private, Capt. Jaines Allen's co., Maj. Eliphalet Cary's regt.;

Pratt, Luther. Private, Capt. Henry Peirce's co.. Col. Theophilus Cotton's

discharged. 

Pratt, "Masa," Mansfield. Private, Capt. Josiah Smith's co.. Col. Whitney's

Pratt ; " also, same co. and regt. ; enlisted June 21, 1776, 4 days preceding

town and harbor of Boston.

John Jacobs's regt. ; engaged June 20, 1778 ; service, 6 mos. 14 days, at Rhode

Suffolk Co. regt. commanded by Maj. Seth Bullard ; marched July 27, 1780; 
discharged Aug. 7. 1780; service, 14 days, including travel (2 days) home; 
regiment marched to Rhode Island on an alarm.

West Point ; also, muster rolls for June and July, 1781, dated Phillipsburgh ;

ter roll for Oct. and Nov., 1781, dated York Hutts; also, return of effectives, 
dated Hutts 1st Brigade, Jan. 18, 1782 ; reported on command in Jersey ; also, 
returns of effectives between June 1, 1781, and June 13, 1783, dated Camp 
West Point, Camp Peekskill, Camp Phillipsburgh, Camp near Dobbs's Ferry, 
Camp Continental Village, Hutts 1st Brigade, Camp at Verplanck's Point, 
Camp at Snake Hill, Camp near New Windsor, Cantonment New Sparta, and 
Winter Quarters, New Windsor ; reported on command at the Block House at 
Dobbs's Ferry from March, 1781; also, Captain, Col. Vose's (1st) regt. ; list of 
officers of 1st Mass. brigade [year not given, probably 1782 or 1783J, showing 
dates of appointments ; commissioned July 5, 1779.

Preast, Joseph. Petition signed by Capt. John Joslin, stating that said Preast 
and others had marched in his company July 30, 1777, and continued in ser- 
vice until the last of Nov., 1777, but he, the said Joslin, having been dis- 
charged the last of Aug., 1777, had made up the pay roll for service of the 
men in question at a lower rate of wages than they were entitled to, and re- 
questing that the balance due them be allowed ; amounts allowed in Council 
April 14, 1778.

Preist, Joseph. Private, Capt. Joseph Bellows's co. ; marched Aug. 22, 1777;

Northern army ; company marched from Lunenburg Aug. 22, 1777, on an alarm 
at Bennington, under command of Maj. Ebenezer Bridge, at request of Gen. 
Stark and Col. Warner, and was discharged by Gen. Lincoln after proceeding 
90 miles.

"Washington" (privateer) , asking that he be commissioned as commander

(privateer) ; petition dated Boston, Sept. 15, 1778, signed by John Tracy, of 
Newburyport, asking that William Springer be commissioned as commander 
of said ves.sel ; ordered in Council Sept. 15, 1778, that a commission be issued ; 
also, petition dated Boston, May 3, 1779, signed by Job Prince, Jr., in behalf 
of Thomas Thomas and others, of Newburyport, asking that said Preston be 
commissioned as commander of the schooner " Shark " (privateer) ; ordered 
in Council May 3, 1779, that a commission be issued.

Priest, Eleazer. Private, Capt. John Hartwell's co., Col. Dike's regt. ; muster

Priest, Elijah. Statement dated Boston, Sept. 22, 1777, signed by said Priest and 
others belonging to Col. Crafts's regt., declaring their refusal to leave Boston, 
unless their bounty or wages, or both, were made equivalent to those allowed 
the soldiers of the Continental train of artillery; also, petition addressed to 
Col. Thomas Crafts, dated Camp at Boston, Sept. 25, 1777, signed by said 
Priest and others, requesting that the objectionable part of their former 
petition, which was considered mutinous, be stricken out, and asking that 
the sergeants of the regiment confined on account of the petition be released; 
also, Capt. David Bradlee's (9th) co.. Col. T. Crafts's regt. ; return of men 
entitled to an additional bounty of £15, dated Boston, Jan. 12, 1778; also, 
same co. and regt. ; list of men who received bounty from April 30, 1777, to 
Dec. 30, 1777, 8 mos.

sioner, by Brig. Gen. John Glover, at Fort Arnold, July 8, 1778 ; also, list of

Priest, Reuben. Private; list of men belonging to Capt. John Gleason's co.,

com, July 26, 1844, states that he engaged the first part of May, 1777, in Capt. 
Gleason's co., Col. Josiah Whitney's regt., and rendered 2 mos. 8 days service 
at Rhode Island ; said company was made up of men from Marlborough, Stow, 
Sudbury, Framingham, Natick, Sherburne, Holliston, and Hopkinton.

Prince, Asa, continued. 

travel allowance home ; also, petition dated Danvers, May 4, 1778, signed 
by said Prince, stating that he had been commissioned as Captain of 2d co., 
8th Essex Co. regt., Sept. 6, 1776; that he had served faithfully in that 
capacity at home and in three campaigns, but as certain field officers under 
whom he declined to serve had been appointed for his regiment, asking per- 
mission to resign his commission ; ordered in Council May 6, 1778, that Col. 
Larkin Thorndike be directed to cause a choice of officers to be made by the 
2d CO., 8th Essex Co. regt., in the room of said Prince and his lieutenants.

Thomas Gardner's regt., which assembled April 19, 1775 ; service, 5 days. 

Pritchard, William. Matross, Capt. Edward Fettyplace's (Marblehead) co. ; 
service from March 1, 1776, to Sept. 1, 1776, 6 mos., in defence of seacoast. 

Pritchard, William. Return signed by Tho. Chase, D. Q. M. G. [year not given], 
of wagoners, artificers, etc., serving in his department ; said Pritchard appears 
among wagon masters stationed at Boston. 

Pritchet, James. Petition addressed to the General Court, dated Sept. 15, 1777, 
signed by said Pritchet, a native of Great Britain , who had been taken prisoner 
and brought into Newburyport by Andrew Giddings, Comman der of the brigan- 
tine " Civil Usage," and confined on board a guard-ship in Boston harbor, stat- 
ing that he was desirous of becoming a subject of Massachusetts and a soldier 
in the army, and asking that he be liberated for that purpose ; ordered in Coun- 
cil Sept. 19, 1777, that the prayer of the petitioner be granted. 

Pritchet, John. Private, Capt. Peter Cushing's co., Col. Solomon Lovel's regt. ; 
service, 4 days ; company raised in Hingham and Cohasset and assembled at 
Hull Dec. 14, 1776. 

Pritchett, William. Boy, ship "General Putnam," commanded by Capt. 
Daniel Waters; engaged July 12, 1779 ; service to Sept. 7, 1779, 1 mo. 25 days, 
on Penobscot expedition. Roll sworn to in Suffolk Co. 

Pritteman, Benjamin. Landsman, frigate " Boston," commanded by Capt. 
Samuel Tucker ; engaged July 3, 1779 ; reported in the " Enterprize." Roll 
made up for advance pay for 1 month.

signed by Larkin Thorndike, requesting that said Procter, Captain, 8th co., 
8th Essex Co. regt., with his 1st Lieutenant, Thomas Gardner, might be dis- 
charged from the respective offices they held, although their prior request 
that they might resign their commissions had been disallowed ; ordered in 
Council June 8, 1779, that the resignations of said Procter and Gardner, above 
named, be accepted, and Col. Thorndike be directed to cause a choice of 
officers to be made to fill their places.

Proctor, William. Petition signed by Lieut. Edward Phelon, of Col. H. Jack- 
son's regt., stating that said Proctor, a Continental soldier, engaged for the 
war, in confinement in Boston jail for committing larceny, and unable to pay 
the fine imposed, £700, had previously served about 5 years in the army, 
during which time his conduct had been irreproachable, and requesting that 
the said Proctor might be permitted to return to his regiment and fill out 
his term of service, as he had already made a settlement with the owner of 
the stolen articles ; ordered in Council Sept. 16, 1780, that the sheriff of 
Suffolk Co. deliver over said Proctor to Lieut. Phelon, who was directed to 
see that he proceeded without delay to his regiment.

vice from June 1, 1776, to Aug. 31, 1776, 3 mos. ; company stationed on 
seacoast.

Aug. 21, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 23, 1777; service, 5 days, including 2 days (40

ward ; also, Capt. March Chase's co., Col. Nathan Sparhawk's regt. ; enlisted 
Sept. 22, 1778; service, 2 mos. 24 days, at Dorchester; company discharged 
Dec. 12, 1778.

Badlam, Superintendent for Suffolk Co., by Justin Ely, Commissioner, at

of 9 months men ; entered service July 24, 1779; discharged April 24, 1780.

Putnam, Israel. 4th Major General ; list of officers appointed by Congress [year 
not given, probably 1775] ; also, general order dated Headquarters, Cambridge,* 
July 22, 1775, making disposition of the forces about Boston and dividing the 
army into 3 grand divisions to consist of 2 brigades each ; said Putnam, Major 
General, to have command of the brigade under Brig. Gen. Heath, and another 
brigade to be commanded by another officer to be designated by the Continen- 
tal Congress, together with a reserve corps for the defence of the several posts 
north of Roxbury not otherwise provided for.

also, same regt. ; petition addressed to the Council, dated Boston, Aug. 16, 
1777, signed by Col. Israel Hutchinson, representing that certain officers who 
belonged to his regiment in 1776, and other officers not of his regiment, were 
prisoners at Long Island, and recommending that advance pay for 1 month 
be sent to each officer; also, draft of a letter of instructions from the Council 
to Capt. Thomas Randall, dated Nov. 3, 1777, directing him to effect the 
exchange of said Putnam, an Ensign, and other prisoners at Long Island, for 
British prisoners to be forwarded to New York in a cartel ; also, list of prison- 
ers dated Feb. 24, 1778, to be exchanged for British prisoners under parole, to 
be returned by Col. Johonnott ; said Putnam to be exchanged for Ensign John- 
son ; reported confined at Long Island ; also, Captain, Col. Nathaniel Wade's 
regt.; commissioned March 14, 1778 ; o/so. Captain, Col. Wade's regt. ; service 
from March 14, 1778, to Dec. 31, 1778, 9 mos. 21 days, at Rhode Island ; roll 
sworn to at East Greenwich ; also, same regt. ; muster roll dated North Kings- 
ton, Nov. 6, 1778; also, same regt. ; muster rolls dated East Greenwich, Sept.

Putnam, John, Great Barrington. Descriptive list dated Lenox, Aug. 20, 1781,

CO., Col. Ashley's regt. ; age, 16 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 5 in. ; complexion, light;

Smith; also. Private, Capt. Benjamin Pike's co., Lieut. Col. Calvin Smith's

from Jan. 15, 1781, to Sept. 1, 1781, 7 mos. 17 days; reported transferred to

Putnam, for money due for service in said regiment.

Putnam, John. Private, Capt. William Thurlo's co. ; travel out and home 180

Bennington Aug. 22, 1777, under command of Maj. Ebenezer Bridge, by order 
of Gen. Stark and Col. Warner, and was dismissed by Gen. Lincoln after 
proceeding 90 miles. Roll sworn to in Worcester Co.

adier General Jan. 7, 1783, and asking that he be appointed accordingly.

factorily as Adjutant from the earliest part of the campaign, although without 
a warrant, and as being willing to continue in service in the same capacity ; 
recommended in Council Nov. 1, 1775, to Gen. Washington to receive a 
warrant.

Dec. 8, 1776; discharged Jan. 21, 1777; service, 1 mo. 14 days, at Providence;

Peter Penniman's co.. Col. Job Cushing's regt. ; service from Aug. 17, 1777, 3 
days preceding march, to time of discharge, 3 mos. 24 days, with Northern 
army.

were in need, and for which said Davis promised to be accountable ; order 
endorsed " Col Frye."

884 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

Pyncheon, Charles, continued. 

tion addressed to the Council, dated Springfield, Sept. 15, 1777, signed by said 
Pyncheon, stating that he had been appointed Colonel, 1st Hampshire Co. 
regt. of Mass. militia ; that he had accepted the aj)pointment with reluctance, 
being advanced in years ; that on account of poor health he was unable to exe- 
cute the duties of the office ; and asking accordingly that his resignation might 
be accepted. 

Pyncheon, Walter. Captain, 1st co., 1st Hampshire Co. regt. of Mass. militia;

by Charles Pyncheon, dated Springfield, May 21, 1776; ordered in Council 
June 13, 1776, that said officers be commissioned with the exception of officers 
of the 12th CO. ; reported commissioned June 13, 1776.

Pynchon, William (also given William, Jr.) . Official record of a ballot by the 
House of Representatives, dated Jan. 31, 1776 ; said Pynchon chosen 1st Major, 
Col. Charles Pynchon's (1st Hampshire Co.) regt. of Mass. militia; appoint- 
ment concurred in by Council Feb. 8, 1776; reported commissioned Feb. 8, 
1776; also, communication addressed to the Council, dated Springfield, Sept. 
15, 1777, signed by said Pynchon, stating that soon after the outbreak of the 
Revolution he had been appointed 1st Major, 1st Hampshire Co. regt. of Mass. 
militia ; that he had accepted the appointment with reluctance and for a 
short time only; that he was satisfied that he could no longer be service- 
able in that capacity ; and asking accordingly that his resignation might be 
accepted.

and Jan. 2, 1778 ; reported discharged by Gen. Gates Nov. 11, 1777.

Ralston, . [This name also appears under the form of Rolston.] 

Ralston, John. Return of sentences by a general court-martial, Lieut. Col. John- 
son, President, appearing in a general order dated Headquarters, Ticonderoga, 
Oct. 3, 1776, taken from Col. Ephraim Wheelock's Orderly Book ; said Ralston, 
" austher " (sutler) , tried on charge of selling rum to soldiers and permitting 
them to be drunk at his tent at unseasonable hours, found guilty, and the 
court unanimously adjudged that he be ordered " off the Guard " and there- 
after prohibited from selling to the Northern army.

May 17, 1775 ; service, 2 mos., 2 weeks, 5 days ; also, same co. and regt. ; com- 
pany return [probably Oct., 1775] ; also, order for bounty coat or its equivalent 
in money dated Cambridge, Oct. 26, 1775.

Randall, Thomas, Boston. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Samuel Gridley's co.. Col.

May 19, 1775; service, 2 mos. 18 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 
1775] ; also, communication addressed to James Bowdoin, President of the 
Council, dated Dunstable, May 6, 1777, signed by Charles Gordon, Lieuten- 
ant, 71st regt., requesting that said Bowdoin would use his influence to secure 
permission for said Gordon to proceed to New York on parole in the endeavor 
to effect an exchange by having an officer of equal rank returned in his stead, 
as was done in the case of Lieut. Christy, of the 71st regt., who had procured 
a similar permission May 31[?], to proceed to New York in exchange for 
said Randall, Lieutenant of Artillery; also, copy of instructions from the 
Council, dated Nov. 3, 1777, addressed to said Randall, Captain, directing him 
to take on board the cartel bound for New York nine British and Scotch officers 
with their servants and deliver them at New York, provided an equal num- 
ber of officers, prisoners on Long Island, including said Randall, he then being 
on parole, were returned and exchanged for them, but in case the enemy 
refused to deliver up the officers whose release was desired, the British and 
Scotch officers on board the cartel were to be brought back to Massachusetts; 
also. Council warrant dated Nov. 7, 1777, for £.300, drawn in favor of said Ran- 
dall, Captain, for the purpose of relieving the necessities of the American pris- 
oners at New York ; also, communication dated New York, Dec. 3, 1777, signed 
by Jos'a Loring, Commissary of Prisoners, stating that said Randall, Captain, 
had been exchanged for Capt. Hamilton Maxwell, agreeable to a certificate 
previously issued, but that by order of His Excellency the General-in-Chief no 
further exchanges should be made until a general exchange should take place ; 
also, Captain of an Independent co. in the corps of artillery, as per Gen.

1779, who were entitled to the gratuity from the State ; above men certified as 
having enlisted for 3 years or during the war and as being in actual service at 
date of return ; company stationed at Springfield ; also, Capt. Bryant's co. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to Dec. 31, 
1780 ; company stationed at West Point. 

Ransom, Newton. Private, Capt. James Walsworth's co.. Col. Elisha Porter's 
(Hampshire Co.) regt.; enlisted July 22, 1779; discharged Aug. 27, 1779; 
service, 1 mo. 11 days, at New London, Conn., including 6 days (116 miles) 
travel home. Roll sworn to at Deerfield.

Goodrich's co., Col. Ashley's regt. ; age, 18 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 7 in. ; complex- 
ion, light ; residence. Great Barrington ; engaged for town of Great Barring-

by Col. R. Putnam, July 20, 1778; also, list of men returned as mustered by

given June 1), 1778.

regt. ; enlisted May 27, 1778 ; discharged Feb. 11, 1779 ; service, 8 mos. 29 days, 
at North river, including 13 days (260 miles) travel home ; also, same co. and 
regt. ; pay roll for Sept., 1778, dated Fort Clinton ; regiment raised for 8 months 
from time of arrival at Peekskill ; also, same co. and regt. ; pay rolls for Nov. 
and Dec, 1778, dated King's Ferry. 

Rawlins, Philip, Winchendon. Private, Capt. Abel Wilder'sco. of Minute-men, 
Col. Ephraim Doolittle's regt., which marched April 20, 1775, in response to 
the alarm of April 19, 1775, to Cambridge ; service, 6 days ; also, Capt. Wilder's 
CO., Col. Doolittle's regt.; receipt for advance pay, signed by said Rawlins 
and others, dated Charlestown, June 26, 1775; also. Private, same co. and 
regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775; enlisted April 26, 1775; service, 3 mos. 
13 days; also, order on Committee of Clothing, payable to Capt. Wilder, 
signed by said Rawlins and John Darling, for money in lieu of bounty coats 
due them for the 8 mos. service in 1775, they never having been paid, as they 
had marched with Col. Arnold on expedition to Quebec, Sept. 13, 1775, and 
had been taken prisoners; Capt. Wilder's certificate in support of order is 
dated Nov. 8, 1776.

joined Capt. Eddy's co.. Col. Bradford's regt.; term, 3 years or during war; 
also, descriptive list of men in Continental service; Capt. Joseph Bates's 
(also given Capt. Hastings's) co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks's (7th) regt. ; rank. 
Drummer; age, 24 yrs. ; stature, 5 ft. 4 (also given 5 ft. 7) in.; complexion, 
light (also given dark) ; hair, dark (also given brown) ; occupation, laborer 
(also given farmer) ; birthplace, Middleborough; residence, Middleborough; 
enlisted Dec. -, 1779, by Capt. Bates ; enlistment, during war ; also. Drummer ; 
lists of men tried by courts-martial subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781 ; Capt. Bates's 
CO., Lieut. Col. Brooks's (7th) regt. ; said Raymond tried March 20, 1781, by 
brigade court-martial, Maj. Porter, President, on charge of stealing cider; 
sentenced to receive 50 lashes ; sentence reported remitted ; tried again May 
18, 1781, by regimental court-martial, Capt. King, President, on charge of 
disobeying orders; sentenced to receive 50 lashes; reported pardoned; also, 
Capt. Joseph Bates's co., Lieut. Col. John Brooks's regt.; muster roll for 
June, 1781; also, muster roll for Aug., 1781, dated Camp at Peekskill ; also, 
muster roll for Sept., 1781 ; also, muster roll for Dec, 1781, dated York Huts 
and sworn to at West Point ; also, register of furloughs granted subsequent to 
Jan. 1, 1781; Capt. Hastings's co. ; leave given said Raymond Dec. 16, 1782, 
by Gen. Paterson to go from New Windsor to Middleborough for 55 days; 
also, list of men who died or were discharged subsequent to Jan. 1, 1781 ; Capt. 
Hastings's CO. ; said Raymond discharged June 10, 1783, by Gen. Washington, 
term of enlistment having expired.

vice from Feb. 20, 1777, to July 7, 1777 ; reported died July 7, 1777 ; also,

George were taken by the enemy; roll sworn to at Sheffield.

Raymond, Edward. Private, Capt. William Tupper's co.. Col. Titcomb's regt. ; 
service, 65 days, in April, May, and June, 1777, under Maj. Gen. Spencer on

vice Sept. 6; discharged Sept. 12; service, 9 days; company marched from 
Middleborough to Dartmouth on two alarms in 1778. 

Raymond, Edward. Certificate dated Halifax Harbor, Oct. 7, 1778, signed by said 
Raymond, Captain, and others, certifying that none of the American prisoners, 
of whom they formed a part and who were to be sent to Boston in the cartel 
" Silver Eel " to be exchanged for British subjects, had been compelled to 
proceed on board, but that all the convalescents went of their own free will 
and at their earnest desire; also, list of prisoners sent in the cartel "Silver 
Eel " from Halifax to Boston Oct. 8, 1778, to be exchanged for British pris- 
oners, as returned by Bat. Fox, Commissary of Prisoners.

Raymond, George. Communication addressed to His Excellency, John Hancock, 
dated Boston, Jan. 29, 1783, signed by Paschal N. Smith, requesting that 
measures be taken to exchange Capt. Thomas Roper, of the brig " Hope," 
sailing under a letter of marque and bound from Lancaster to Anquilla and 
which was taken and brt)ught into Boston by the ship " Fortune," Capt. Bil- 
lings, for said Raymond, Captain, who had been taken in the "Hermione" 
and carried a prisoner to New York some time previously ; advised in Council 
Jan. 29, 1783, that Maj. John Hopkins, Commissary of Prisoners, be directed 
to effect the exchange.

Dec. 11, 1780, signed hy Col. Benjamin Tupper, stating that His Excellency 
Gen. Washington had expressed his opinion that all vacancies which existed 
before Nov. 1, 1780, ought to be filled in order to bring about a settlement of 
ranks as authorized under the new arrangement for the army, and recommend- 
ing that certain officers be promoted to fill vacancies in the 11th Mass. regt. ; 
said Raymond, Ensign, to be promoted to a Lieutenant, his appointment to 
date from Oct. 27, 1780 ; ordered in Council Dec. 15, 1780, that warrants be issued 
to said officers; also. Lieutenant, Col. Benjamin Tupper's (10th) regt., com- 
manded by Col. Thomas Marshall prior to Jan. 1, 1781 ; pay roll made up for

1782, naming Moses Carlton, an Ensign in the 15th Mass. regt., as entitled to 
the vacant lieutenancy in the 10th Mass. regt. occasioned by the resignation 
of said Raymond, Lieutenant, who was discharged May 7, 1782.

Raynes, Nathaniel. 2d Lieutenant, Capt. Joseph Bragdon, Jr.'s 7th (York) co., 
Col. Ebenezer Sayer's (1st York Co.) regt. of Mass. militia; list of officers 
chosen by the several companies in said regiment, dated Wells, June 12, 1776 ; 
ordered in Council June 25, 1776, that said officers be commissioned ; reported 
commissioned June 26, 1776; rt/,so, communication addressed to the Council, 
dated York, Sept. 2, 1779, signed by said Raynes, stating that he had been 
chosen 2d Lieutenant, 6th co., 1st York Co. regt. of Mass. militia, and had 
been commissioned June 25, 1776, and requesting leave to resign said commis- 
sion on account of the disputed legality of his choice to the office aforesaid ; 
acceptance of the resignation is advised by Col. Edward Grow for the good of 
the service ; resignation accepted in Council Sept. 16, 1779.

1780; discharged Dec. 26, 1780; service, 6 mos. 3 days, including travel (220 
miles) home. 

Raynolds, Ezra, Middleborough. Private, Major's co.. Col. Bradford's regt. ; 
Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1780, to May 6, 1780 ; 
residence, Middleborough. 

Raynolds, John. Private, Capt. Nathan Rowlee's co., Lieut. Col. Timothy Rob- 
inson's detachment of Hampshire Co. militia; entered service Jan. 9, 1777; 
service to April 3, 1777, 83 days, at Ticonderoga. 

Raynolds, Joseph. Private, Capt. William Hooper's co. ; service from June 1, 
1776, to date of discharge, Nov. 15, 1776, 5 mos. 15 days. Rolls dated 
Marblehead. 

Raynolds, Robert. Private, 4th co. ; entries dated Oct. 16, and Dec. 26, 1783, of 
orders for wages for May-June, and Aug.-Dec. [year not given], appearing in 
a register of orders accepted on account of wages, etc. 

Raynolds, Thomas. Descriptive list of men mustered for Continental service 
subsequent to Sept. 16 [year not given], by James Leonard, Muster Master for 
Bristol Co. ; Capt. Jonathan Drown's co.. Col. Lea's (Lee's) regt. ; age, 41 
yrs. ; stature, 6 ft. ; engaged for town of Rehoboth. 

Raynols, Benjamin. Private, Capt. Henry Peirce's co.. Col. Ebenezer White's 
regt. ; marched Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; service, 9 days; com- 
pany marched to Rhode Island on an alarm. Roll sworn to at Middleborough. 

Raynols, Election. Private, Capt. Henry Peirce's co.. Col. Ebenezer White's 
regt.; marched Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; service, 9 days; com- 
pany marched to Rhode Island on an alarm. Roll sworn to at Middleborough. 



1016 MASSACHUSETTS SOLDIERS AND SAILORS 

Raynols, Enos. Private, Capt. Henry Peirce's co., Col. Ebenezer White's regt. ; 
inarched Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; service, 9 days; company 
marched to Rhode Island on an alarm. Roll sworn to at Middleborough. 

Raynols, Ezra. Private, Capt. Henry Peirce's co., Col. Ebenezer White's regt. ; 
marched Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; service, 9 days; company 
marched to Rhode Island on an alarm. Roll sworn to at Middleborough. 

Raynols, Isaac. Private, Capt. Henry Peirce's co.. Col. Ebenezer White's regt. ; 
marched Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; service, 9 days; company 
marched to Rhode Island on an alarm. Roll sworn to at Middleborough. 

Raynols, John. Private, Capt. Henry Peirce's co.. Col. Ebenezer White's regt. ; 
marched Aug. 1, 1780; discharged Aug. 9, 1780; service, 9 days; company 
marched to Rliode Island on an alarm. Roll sworn to at Middleborough. 

Raynor, . [This name also appears under the form of Rainer, Ranor, Rayner.] 

Raynor, Hugh, Marblehead. Drummer, Capt. Nicholson Broughton's (5th) co., 
Col. John Glover's (21st) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted May 
19, 1775; service, 2 mos. 18 days; also, company return [probably Oct., 1775J ; 
reported discharged. 

Rayns, Edward, York. Fifer, Capt. Samuel Leighton's co., Col. Ebenezer 
Francis's regt. ; pay roll for travel allowance, etc., from Dorchester Heights 
home ; said Rayns credited with allowance for 5 days (95 miles) travel ; war- 
rant allowed in Council Nov. 29, 1776. 

Rayns, John. Corporal, Capt. Nathaniel Fales's co. ; entered service Aug. 3, 1779 ; 
discharged Aug. 15, 1779 ; service, 13 days, at Penobscot ; company marched 
on expedition to Majorbagaduce by order of Gen. Lovel. 

Raynsford, Solomon. Private, Capt. Zenas Wheeler's co.. Col. John Ashley's 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service July 8, 1777 ; discharged July 27, 1777 ; 
service, 20 days; company marched to Fort Edward, N. Y., and received pay 
at Albany; also, Capt. Adam Kasson's co., Col. John Ashley's (Berkshire 
Co.) regt.; entered service Oct. 14, 1780; discharged Oct. 16, 1780; service, 
6 days, by order of Gen. Fellows on an alarm at the Northward, including 
travel (3 days) home. 

Raynsford, Thomas. Private, Capt. Zenas Wheeler's co.. Col. John Ashley's 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service July 8, 1777 ; discharged Aug. 15, 1777 ; 
service, .39 days ; company marched to Fort Edward, N. Y., and received pay 
at Albany. 

Raysey, Joseph, Wrentham. Private, Capt. Oliver Pond's co. of Minute-men, 
which marched on the alarm of April 19, 1775 ; service, 8 days. 

Raywood, Sim'n. List of prisoners sent from New York in the cartel " Rising 
Empire," as returned by Commissary Godfrey [year not given] ; reported as 
belonging to Connecticut and as employed in the "Oliver Cromwell," of 
Connecticut. 

Razaray, Cuff, Abington. Private, Lieutenant Colonel's co., (late) Col. Wig- 
glesworth's regt. ; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Feb. 28, 
1777, to Dec. 31, 1779 ; residence, Abington ; credited to town of Abington ; 
also, Capt. Daniel Pillsbury's co.. Col. Edward Wigglesworth's (4th) regt.; 
return [year not given] ; mustered by County Muster Master; also, same co. 
and regt. ; muster roll for May, 1778, dated Valley Forge ; also, same co. and 
regt.; muster roll for June, 1778, dated " Greenage ; " also, same co. and 
regt. ; pay roll for Oct., 1778, sworn to at Providence ; also, (late) Lieut. Dud- 
ley Coleman's co., (late) Col. Wigglesworth's regt. commanded by Maj. 
Porter; muster roll for March and April, 1779, dated Providence; enlisted 
Feb. 28, 1777.

Razey, . [This name also appears under the form of Raysey.] 

Razey, Benjamin. Private, Capt. Samuel Low's co., Col. Benjamin Simonds's 
(Berkshire Co.) regt. ; entered service Oct. li, 1780 ; discharged Oct. 17, 1780 ; 
service, 4 days, by order of Brig. Gen. Fellows on the alarm at the Northward 
of Oct. 13, 1780. 

Razey, Joseph, "Wrentham. Private, Capt. Oliver Pond's co., Col. Joseph 
Read's (20th) regt. ; muster roll dated Aug. 1, 1775 ; enlisted April 27, 1775 ; 
service, 3 mos. 12 days; also, company return dated Sept. 25, 1775.
